analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su padma dang zla ba'i steng du / aom badzra ma ni dha ra sarbba aartha siddha pra yatstsha ho bha ga w'an badzra ratna h'um /
translated: In the center of the maṇḍala, upon a lotus and moon,

original: zhes brjod cing bcom ldan 'das don thams cad grub pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes brjod cing bcom ldan 'das don thams cad grub pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: one should draw Bhagavān Sarvārthasiddha, saying:🔽“Oṃ vajra maṇi dhāra sarva arthasiddha prayaccha ho bhagavān vajraratna hūṃ.”

original: de nas don thams cad grub pa'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i cho gas rdo rje nor bu chen po bcings te /
analyzed: de nas don thams cad grub pa'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i cho gas rdo rje nor bu chen po bcings te /
translated: Then, binding the great vajra jewel with the rite of the great maṇḍala of Sarvārthasiddhi,

original: ji lta ba bzhin du dbab pa dang / cho ga thams cad rjes su spyad la /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du dbab pa dang / cho ga thams cad rjes su spyad la /
translated: one should perform the descent of the gnosis being just as before and practice the entire rite.

original: rin chen slob ma 'jug pa nas dngos grub kyi rdo rje brtul zhugs kyi mthar thug pa de dag ni cho ga thams cad ces bstan to ;
analyzed: rin chen slob ma 'jug pa nas dngos grub kyi rdo rje brtul zhugs kyi mthar thug pa de dag ni cho ga thams cad ces bstan to ;
translated: From the admission of the jewel disciple up to the end of the spiritual powers and vajra conduct, those are called “the entire rite.”

original: / de ltar slob dpon gyi las dang slob ma 'jug pa'i cho ga rgyas par bstan nas /
analyzed: / de ltar slob dpon gyi las dang slob ma 'jug pa'i cho ga rgyas par bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the extensive ritual of the master's acts and the initiation of the disciple,

original: da ni nam mkha'i snying po'i phyag rgya gcig pa'i dkyil 'khor du dbang bskur ba thob la slob dpon gyis dngos grub kyi ye shes bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i cho ga bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni nam mkha'i snying po'i phyag rgya gcig pa'i dkyil 'khor du dbang bskur ba thob la slob dpon gyis dngos grub kyi ye shes bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i cho ga bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach the ritual of the master's teaching the knowledge of powers to one who has obtained initiation in the single-seal maṇḍala of Ākāśagarbha,

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “Then,” and so on.

original: de nas kyi sgra ni de ma thag par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de nas kyi sgra ni de ma thag par brjod pa'o //
translated: The word “then” expresses immediately after.

original: slob ma 'jug pa'i cho ga rgyas pa'i rjes thogs la'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: slob ma 'jug pa'i cho ga rgyas pa'i rjes thogs la'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is “immediately after the extensive ritual of the initiation of the disciple.”

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni don thams cad grub pa'i phyag rgya gcig pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni don thams cad grub pa'i phyag rgya gcig pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: “This” is the single-seal maṇḍala of Sarvārthasiddhi.

original: ye shes ni rang gi lha bsgoms pa las byung ba'i rang gi lhar nges pa'o//
analyzed: ye shes ni rang gi lha bsgoms pa las byung ba'i rang gi lhar nges pa'o//
translated: “Knowledge” is the ascertainment of one’s deity that arises from the meditation on one’s deity.

original: de'i gsang ba'i phyag rgya ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa rang gi lhar nges pa sems can gyi khams kyi de'i rang bzhin du byed par mos pa la der nges pa'i ye shes de bslab pa ste bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i gsang ba'i phyag rgya ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa rang gi lhar nges pa sems can gyi khams kyi de'i rang bzhin du byed par mos pa la der nges pa'i ye shes de bslab pa ste bstan par bya'o //
translated: The secret seal of that is the teaching of the intuition of the ascertainment of that, i.e. of the Tathagatas, etc. as one’s own deity, in the realm of sentient beings, as having that nature.

original: gzugs ni don thams cad grub pa'i dum bu las bshad pa'i rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs so//
analyzed: gzugs ni don thams cad grub pa'i dum bu las bshad pa'i rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs so//
translated: The form is the family of Vairocana, as explained in the chapter on the accomplishment of all aims.

original: sogs pa smos pa ni don thams cad grub pa dang / rin chen lta ba dang / rin chen padma dang / rin chen char 'bebs kyi gzugs rnams gzung bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pa ni don thams cad grub pa dang / rin chen lta ba dang / rin chen padma dang / rin chen char 'bebs kyi gzugs rnams gzung bar bya ba'o //
translated: The “etc.” refers to the forms of all the others, such as the accomplishment of all aims, the jewel-gazing, the jewel-lotus, and the jewel-rain.

original: gzugs la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de la gzugs la sogs pa des 'di skad du bshad pa'i don thams cad grub pa la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de la gzugs la sogs pa des 'di skad du bshad pa'i don thams cad grub pa la sogs pa'o ;
translated: The form, etc. are the accomplishment of all aims, etc. as explained above.

original: / de nyid kyi 'dod pa rnams ni 'dris par bya ba mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: / de nyid kyi 'dod pa rnams ni 'dris par bya ba mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The desires of that are the desire to become familiar with, i.e. to realize, that.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba ste /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba ste /
translated: The word “also” is for emphasis.

original: gzugs la sogs pa kho na 'dod pa rnams yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa kho na 'dod pa rnams yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Only form, etc. are the enjoyments.🔽Because of the enjoyment of form, etc.,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i 'dod pa dang / goms par byas pas na /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i 'dod pa dang / goms par byas pas na /
translated: and because of the practice,🔽there is the arising of pleasure.

original: bde @163b ba skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: bde @163b ba skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That is what is called “the enjoyment of pleasure.”

original: bshad ma thag pa de'i chags pa dang bral bar gyur pa'i bde ba dbul ba'o //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa de'i chags pa dang bral bar gyur pa'i bde ba dbul ba'o //
translated: The enjoyment of pleasure is the freedom from attachment to that which was just explained.

original: gang la zhe na sangs rgyas la'o //
analyzed: gang la zhe na sangs rgyas la'o //
translated: To what? To the Buddha.

original: ci zhig thob par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig thob par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is attained?

original: las kyi dngos grub thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: las kyi dngos grub thob par 'gyur //
translated: The attainment of the power of karma.

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: nor bu chen po'i dngos grub thob pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nor bu chen po'i dngos grub thob pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The attainment of the power of the great jewel is the meaning of the verse.

original: di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: don thams cad grub pa'i dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor byas la /
analyzed: don thams cad grub pa'i dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor byas la /
translated: Having performed the yoga of one’s deity as explained in the great maṇḍala of Sarvārthasiddhi,

original: de las bshad pa dang / gzungs dang / chos dang / las kyi dkyil 'khor las bshad pa rang gi lha bsgoms la de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa sems can gyi khams rang gi lha'i rang bzhin du nges par byas pa de lta bu'i bde ba de sangs rgyas rnams la de dbul bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de las bshad pa dang / gzungs dang / chos dang / las kyi dkyil 'khor las bshad pa rang gi lha bsgoms la de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa sems can gyi khams rang gi lha'i rang bzhin du nges par byas pa de lta bu'i bde ba de sangs rgyas rnams la de dbul bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Having meditated on one's deity as explained in the retention, doctrine, and action maṇḍalas, one should offer that bliss to the buddhas, having ascertained the realm of sentient beings, such as the tathāgatas, to be the nature of one's deity.

original: de nas de ltar bsgoms pas nor bu chen po'i rigs las bshad pa'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas de ltar bsgoms pas nor bu chen po'i rigs las bshad pa'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, by meditating in that way, one will attain the powers explained in the great jewel family.

original: nor bu chen po'i rigs su gsungs pa'i dngos grub rnams ni don thams cad grub pa'i dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i phyag rgya bzhis rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor byas la bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba'i cho ga 'di bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nor bu chen po'i rigs su gsungs pa'i dngos grub rnams ni don thams cad grub pa'i dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i phyag rgya bzhis rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor byas la bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba'i cho ga 'di bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The powers taught in the great jewel family are to be accomplished by practicing the yoga of one's deity with the four seals explained in the great maṇḍala of all accomplishments. In order to teach this procedure,

original: de nas phyag rgya bzhi'i ye shes bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas phyag rgya bzhi'i ye shes bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: it is said, Then, one should learn the wisdom of the four seals.

original: de la don thams cad grub pa'i dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i bcom ldan 'das don thams cad grub pa'am gzhan dag gi phyag rgya chen po dang / dam tshig dang / chos kyi phyag rgya dang / las kyi phyag rgya rnams so //
analyzed: de la don thams cad grub pa'i dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i bcom ldan 'das don thams cad grub pa'am gzhan dag gi phyag rgya chen po dang / dam tshig dang / chos kyi phyag rgya dang / las kyi phyag rgya rnams so //
translated: In this case, the great maṇḍala of Sarvārthasiddhi is explained in the Tantra of Sarvārthasiddhi, or the great seal of others, the pledge seal, the doctrine seal, and the action seal.

original: de la ji ltar bstan pa'i rnam pa bzhi'i ye shes bslab par bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la ji ltar bstan pa'i rnam pa bzhi'i ye shes bslab par bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
translated: In this case, the teaching is the training in the gnosis of the four aspects as taught.

original: de ltar ras la sogs pa la yang sems dpa' ni rdo rje snying po'o //
analyzed: de ltar ras la sogs pa la yang sems dpa' ni rdo rje snying po'o //
translated: In this way, the hero on cloth, etc., is the vajra essence.

original: phyag rgya ni de'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya ni de'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: The seal is its sign.

original: ras la sogs pa la dkyil 'khor bris te bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni don thams cad grub pa'i phyag rgya gcig pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: ras la sogs pa la dkyil 'khor bris te bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni don thams cad grub pa'i phyag rgya gcig pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'grel pa'o //
translated: Having drawn the maṇḍala on cloth, etc., one should accomplish it. This is the commentary on the maṇḍala of the single seal of Sarvārthasiddhi.

original: de nas yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dum bur bshad zin to //
analyzed: de nas yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dum bur bshad zin to //
translated: Then, etc. is explained in the Vajradhātu section.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi las ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi las te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi las ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi las te /
translated: The action of all the Tathagatas is the action of all the Tathagatas.

original: sems can gyi bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i rin po che'i rigs rtog pa bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i rin po che'i rigs rtog pa bskyed pa'o //
translated: It is the generation of the jewel family which fulfills all the wishes of sentient beings.

original: de'i dam tshig ni nor bu chen po'i rigs bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur @164a * //
analyzed: de'i dam tshig ni nor bu chen po'i rigs bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur @164a * //
translated: Its commitment is the cause of the generation of the great jewel family.

original: pa ste / de nyid kyi rtog pa ni brtag pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa ste / de nyid kyi rtog pa ni brtag pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That itself is the conception, because it arises from the conception.

original: de ston par byed pa'i sgra'i tshogs la yang rtog pa chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ston par byed pa'i sgra'i tshogs la yang rtog pa chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: The collection of words which teaches that is also called the great conception.

original: de nyid kyi rtog pa thams cad kyis sems can thams cad la dbang bskur bar gsol ba rnams zil gyis mnan nas mdzes shing 'bar bar gyur pas na rgyal po'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi rtog pa thams cad kyis sems can thams cad la dbang bskur bar gsol ba rnams zil gyis mnan nas mdzes shing 'bar bar gyur pas na rgyal po'o //
translated: It is a king because it outshines all the conceptions of that, and it becomes beautiful and radiant by granting the consecration of sovereignty to all sentient beings with all those.

original: rdzogs pa'i rtsa ba ni rgyud kyi mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rtsa ba ni rgyud kyi mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The root of perfection is the end of the tantra.

original: nor bu chen po'i rigs 'di thams cad kyis sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i las byed pa de'i phyir las kyi rigs kyi las kyi phyag rgya zhes brjod de /
analyzed: nor bu chen po'i rigs 'di thams cad kyis sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i las byed pa de'i phyir las kyi rigs kyi las kyi phyag rgya zhes brjod de /
translated: This is the action of the great jewel family, which fulfills all the wishes of all sentient beings. Therefore, it is called the action seal of the action family.

original: dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i las kyis sems can gyi khams la rgyas 'debs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i las kyis sems can gyi khams la rgyas 'debs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it seals the realm of sentient beings with the action of consecration and so forth.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: 'dir / khams gsum pa yi chos chen po //
analyzed: 'dir / khams gsum pa yi chos chen po //
translated: Here, the great Dharma of the three realms,🔽the supreme king who bestows consecration,🔽in order to destroy the stain of miserliness

original: dbang bskur ster ba'i rgyal po mchog / ser sna'i dri ma gzhig phyir dang // sems can bsam pa yongs rdzogs phyir //
analyzed: dbang bskur ster ba'i rgyal po mchog / ser sna'i dri ma gzhig phyir dang // sems can bsam pa yongs rdzogs phyir //
translated: and to fulfill the wishes of sentient beings,

original: don kun grub pa'i dpa' bo ni //
analyzed: don kun grub pa'i dpa' bo ni //
translated: the hero who accomplishes all aims,

original: nam mkha'i mthar thug grags pa yi //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mthar thug grags pa yi //
translated: renowned to the end of space,

original: rdo rje rin chen rigs bskyed phyir //
analyzed: rdo rje rin chen rigs bskyed phyir //
translated: in order to generate the vajra jewel family,

original: rtog pa'i rgyal po 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: rtog pa'i rgyal po 'di gsungs so //
translated: spoke this king of contemplations.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //🔽sems can khams ni dpag med pa //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no // sems can khams ni dpag med pa //
translated: Thus it is said.🔽In order to turn away the confusion

original: rmongs pa rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rmongs pa rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir //
translated: of the immeasurable realm of sentient beings,

original: snang byed dge ba 'di bshad las //
analyzed: snang byed dge ba 'di bshad las //
translated: is explained in this composition.

original: bdag gis dge ba 'di bsags pas ;
analyzed: bdag gis dge ba 'di bsags pas ;
translated: By my accumulation of this virtue,

original: / de yis 'jig rten ma lus pa //
analyzed: / de yis 'jig rten ma lus pa //
translated: may the entire world

original: nor bu'i rigs kyi kun dga' che //
analyzed: nor bu'i rigs kyi kun dga' che //
translated: attain the great joy of the jewel family,

original: snying po bsam mi khyab chen gtso //
analyzed: snying po bsam mi khyab chen gtso //
translated: the chief of the inconceivable great essence,

original: don kun grub pa rgyal gyur cig //
analyzed: don kun grub pa rgyal gyur cig //
translated: and may the accomplishment of all aims be victorious.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i 'grel pa de kho na nyid snang bar byed pa zhes bya ba las nor bu chen po'i rigs kyi 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i 'grel pa de kho na nyid snang bar byed pa zhes bya ba las nor bu chen po'i rigs kyi 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary called Illuminating Reality, from The Commentary on the Compendium of Principles of All Tathāgatas, is completed.

original: // / de ltar 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad kyi de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa sems can thams cad kyi thun mong du gyur pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid bsdus pa zhes bya ba
analyzed: // / de ltar 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad kyi de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa sems can thams cad kyi thun mong du gyur pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid bsdus pa zhes bya ba
translated: Thus, the nature of the reality of all mundane and supramundane phenomena, which is the commonality of all sentient beings, is the Compendium of Principles of All Tathāgatas,

original: theg pa chen po'i mdo /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i mdo /
translated: a Mahāyāna sūtra.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud bstan nas /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the root tantra,

original: da ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mchog gi dngos grub sgrub pa'i gong ma'i yang gong ma'i sems can rjes su gzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mchog gi dngos grub sgrub pa'i gong ma'i yang gong ma'i sems can rjes su gzung ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to take care of the highest of the high beings who are striving for the highest supramundane powers,

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i dam tshig chen po'i de kho na nyid sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa de bzhin gshegs pa dang / de'i @164b rigs dang / rdo rje dang / padma dang / nor bu'i rigs kyi rgyud phyi ma ni /
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i dam tshig chen po'i de kho na nyid sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa de bzhin gshegs pa dang / de'i @164b rigs dang / rdo rje dang / padma dang / nor bu'i rigs kyi rgyud phyi ma ni /
translated: the suchness of the great commitment without beginning or end, which is the cause for attaining the state of a buddha and a bodhisattva, the continuation of the tantras of the Tathagata, his family, the vajra, the lotus, and the jewel families,

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyag na rdo rjes zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽'di skad du bshad pa 'di ni rtsa ba'i rgyud do //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyag na rdo rjes zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // 'di skad du bshad pa 'di ni rtsa ba'i rgyud do //
translated: is taught beginning with the words, “Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Vajrapāṇi . . .”🔽This is explained as follows: This is the root tantra.

original: 'di ni rgyud phyi ma'i 'o zhes bya ba de skad du yang /
analyzed: 'di ni rgyud phyi ma'i 'o zhes bya ba de skad du yang /
translated: This is the continuation of the tantra.

original: ji ltar shes par bya zhe na ;
analyzed: ji ltar shes par bya zhe na ;
translated: How is this to be known?

original: 'di ni 'chad par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'chad par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: This will be explained.🔽Immediately after the teaching of the continuation of the tantra,

original: de skad du rgyud phyi ma bstan pa'i rjes thogs la /
analyzed: de skad du rgyud phyi ma bstan pa'i rjes thogs la /
translated: it says:

original: lta ba ngan zhing chags bral la //
analyzed: lta ba ngan zhing chags bral la //
translated: It is not right to keep this secret

original: gsang ba 'di ni mi rigs te //
analyzed: gsang ba 'di ni mi rigs te //
translated: from those who are detached and have bad views.

original: sems can kun la phan don du //
analyzed: sems can kun la phan don du //
translated: But for the sake of benefiting all sentient beings,

original: de bzhin cho ga bshad par bya //
analyzed: de bzhin cho ga bshad par bya //
translated: I will explain the ritual in the same way.

original: zhes phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is explained later.

original: gzhan yang gang 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyor ba'i chos kyi de kho na nyid la sogs pa 'ang ston pa de ni rtsa ba'i rgyud do //
analyzed: gzhan yang gang 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyor ba'i chos kyi de kho na nyid la sogs pa 'ang ston pa de ni rtsa ba'i rgyud do //
translated: Moreover, the root tantra is that which teaches the reality of the Dharma of mundane and supramundane practice, and so forth.

original: gang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dam tshig chen po'i de kho na nyid ston pa de ni rgyud phyi ma'i'o //
analyzed: gang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dam tshig chen po'i de kho na nyid ston pa de ni rgyud phyi ma'i'o //
translated: The later tantra is that which teaches the reality of the great supramundane commitments.

original: rgyud phyi ma ni /
analyzed: rgyud phyi ma ni /
translated: The later tantra states:

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud rnams thams cad las //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud rnams thams cad las //
translated: Among all the root tantras,

original: bla ma'i bla ma don gnyer ba'i //
analyzed: bla ma'i bla ma don gnyer ba'i //
translated: those who seek the supreme meaning

original: sems can bla med sgrub pa rnams //
analyzed: sems can bla med sgrub pa rnams //
translated: and sentient beings who practice the unsurpassed

original: rdo rje can rnams byin rlob pa'o //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rdo rje can rnams byin rlob pa'o // zhes gsungs so //
translated: are blessed by the vajra holders.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni skabs su bab pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni skabs su bab pa ste /
translated: Then means at the appropriate time,

original: dngos grub dam pa sgrub pa ston pa'i skabs su bab ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos grub dam pa sgrub pa ston pa'i skabs su bab ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: meaning that the time has come to teach the practice of the supreme attainment.

original: phyag na rdo rje ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
translated: Vajrapāṇi is Great Vajradhara.

original: de nyid byang chub chen po'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir byang chub chen po'o //
analyzed: de nyid byang chub chen po'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir byang chub chen po'o //
translated: He is the Great Awakening, because he is the nature of the Great Awakening.

original: de yang gang gis yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang gis yin zhe na /
translated: And what is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The statement “of all the Tathāgatas” and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs so //
translated: The family of all the Tathāgatas is the family of all the Tathāgatas.

original: de la rnam par snang mdzad dang / mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / 'od dpag tu med pa dang / don yod par grub pa'i rang bzhin ni 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad do //
analyzed: de la rnam par snang mdzad dang / mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / 'od dpag tu med pa dang / don yod par grub pa'i rang bzhin ni 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad do //
translated: Here, Vairocana, Akṣobhya, Ratnasaṃbhava, Amitābha, and Amoghasiddhi are all the Tathāgatas, because they are the nature of the Great Awakening.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' nas brtsams nas /🔽rdo rje 'bebs pa'i mthar thug pa rdo rje dbyings kyi dum bu las bshad pa ni /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' nas brtsams nas / rdo rje 'bebs pa'i mthar thug pa rdo rje dbyings kyi dum bu las bshad pa ni /
translated: Beginning with Vajrasattva,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs so //
translated: and ending with Vajra-Āveśa, the explanation in the Vajradhātu section is the family of the Tathāgatas.

original: 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i dum bu las bshad pa'i rdo rje h'um mdzad nas brtsams nas /🔽khro bo rdo rje 'bebs pa'i mthar thug pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i dum bu las bshad pa'i rdo rje h'um mdzad nas brtsams nas / khro bo rdo rje 'bebs pa'i mthar thug pa ni /
translated: The Vajra Humkara, etc., explained in the Vajra Portion of the Three Worlds Conqueror,

original: rdo rje'i rigs so //🔽'gro ba 'dul ba'i dum bu las bshad pa'i 'gro ba 'dul ba la sogs pa nas padma 'bebs pa'i @165a * //
analyzed: rdo rje'i rigs so // 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dum bu las bshad pa'i 'gro ba 'dul ba la sogs pa nas padma 'bebs pa'i @165a * //
translated: up to the Vajra Wrathful One, are the Vajra Family.

original: mthar thug pa ni padma'i rigs so //
analyzed: mthar thug pa ni padma'i rigs so //
translated: The Lokesvara, etc., explained in the Lokesvara Portion, up to the Padma Wrathful One, are the Padma Family.

original: nor bu'i dum bu las bshad pa'i don thams cad grub pa la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: nor bu'i dum bu las bshad pa'i don thams cad grub pa la sogs pa nas /
translated: The Sarvarthasiddha, etc., explained in the Jewel Portion, up to the Ratna Wrathful One, are the Jewel Family.

original: rin chen 'bebs pa'i mthar thug pa'i snying po dang / phyag rgya dang sngags dang / rig pa'i cho ga thams cad ni rin po che'i rigs so //🔽de dag chen po de yang yin la de kho na nyid kyang de yin pas na /
analyzed: rin chen 'bebs pa'i mthar thug pa'i snying po dang / phyag rgya dang sngags dang / rig pa'i cho ga thams cad ni rin po che'i rigs so // de dag chen po de yang yin la de kho na nyid kyang de yin pas na /
translated: The essence, seal, mantra, and all the rites of knowledge of these are the Jewel Family.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs kyi de kho na nyid chen po ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs kyi de kho na nyid chen po ste /
translated: That is the Great Reality of the Families of all the Tathagatas.

original: dkyil 'khor chen po dang gzungs dang chos dang / las kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i dngos grub chen po sgrub par byed pa de dag gi cho ga rgyas pa 'di ni bya ba'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen po dang gzungs dang chos dang / las kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i dngos grub chen po sgrub par byed pa de dag gi cho ga rgyas pa 'di ni bya ba'o //
translated: This extensive rite is for those who seek to achieve the great powers of the great maṇḍala, the retention maṇḍala, the Dharma maṇḍala, and the Action maṇḍala, such as the great seal, etc.

original: 'di ni mi bya ba'o zhes nges par nan tan du bya ba'i khyad par de ston pa'i sgra'i tshogs kyi rgyud la yang de skad ces ston to //
analyzed: 'di ni mi bya ba'o zhes nges par nan tan du bya ba'i khyad par de ston pa'i sgra'i tshogs kyi rgyud la yang de skad ces ston to //
translated: It is taught in the Tantra of the Assembly of Sounds that this is to be done and this is not to be done in order to show the distinctions of what is to be earnestly practiced.

original: rgyud ni rgyud pas na'o //
analyzed: rgyud ni rgyud pas na'o //
translated: A tantra is so called because it is woven (tan-).

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni thugs la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni thugs la gnas pa'o //
translated: The word this refers to what is in the mind.

original: gsungs so zhes bya ba ni de bka' stsal cing bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs so zhes bya ba ni de bka' stsal cing bshad pa'o //
translated: The word taught means that it was spoken and explained by him.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni dmigs kyis bkar ba'o //🔽re zhig ces bya ba ni rim pa la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni dmigs kyis bkar ba'o // re zhig ces bya ba ni rim pa la ltos pa'o //
translated: The word therein is a specification.

original: dang po zhes bya ba ni thog mar ro //
analyzed: dang po zhes bya ba ni thog mar ro //
translated: The word first means at the beginning.

original: phyag rgya yang yin la chen po yang de yin pas phyag rgya chen po ste /
analyzed: phyag rgya yang yin la chen po yang de yin pas phyag rgya chen po ste /
translated: Since it is a seal (mudra) and it is great (maha), it is a great seal (maha-mudra).

original: sku'i gsang ba'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: sku'i gsang ba'i ngo bo'o //
translated: It is the essence of the secret of the body.

original: de'i dam pa'i dngos grub bam de rnams kyi phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ni dam pa'i dngos grub bo //
analyzed: de'i dam pa'i dngos grub bam de rnams kyi phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ni dam pa'i dngos grub bo //
translated: The “mastery of the supreme” or “mastery of the great seal of those” is the mastery of the supreme.

original: de ston par byed pa'i rgyud la yang de skad ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ston par byed pa'i rgyud la yang de skad ces bya ba yin no //
translated: The tantra that teaches that is called that.

original: dang por re zhig de bzhin gshegs pa rigs kyi dkyil 'khor chen por gsungs pa'i phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi rgyud 'byung la /
analyzed: dang por re zhig de bzhin gshegs pa rigs kyi dkyil 'khor chen por gsungs pa'i phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi rgyud 'byung la /
translated: First, the tantra of the great seal mastery taught in the great maṇḍala of the Tathāgata’s family arises.

original: phyis dam tshig gi phyag rgya gtso bor gyur pa'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs ba'i phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa yang 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: phyis dam tshig gi phyag rgya gtso bor gyur pa'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs ba'i phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa yang 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Later, the great seal, etc., taught in the dhāraṇī maṇḍala, with the pledge seal as the main one, also arises.

original: phyag rgya chen po dam pa'i dngos grub kyi rgyud 'di gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po dam pa'i dngos grub kyi rgyud 'di gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is this tantra of the great seal mastery of the supreme?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag rgya che //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag rgya che //
translated: The great seal of the tathāgatas

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: is taught, etc.

original: rnam par snang mdzad dang / mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / 'od dpag med dang ; don yod grub pa'i rang bzhin gyis de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi phyag rgya chen po'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad dang / mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / 'od dpag med dang ; don yod grub pa'i rang bzhin gyis de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi phyag rgya chen po'o //
translated: The great seal of those Tathāgatas is the nature of Vairocana, Akṣobhya, Ratnasaṃbhava, Amitābha, and Amoghasiddhi.

original: bcings nas mkha' dbyings thams cad du //
analyzed: bcings nas mkha' dbyings thams cad du //
translated: Having bound, in all the realm of space,🔽the forms of the Buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas sku gzugs byin brlabs la //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sku gzugs byin brlabs la //
translated: bless them.

original: zhes bya ba la mkha'i ni nam mkha'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la mkha'i ni nam mkha'o //
translated: “Space” is the sky.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad du rdul phra rab kyi tshogs @165b ni de rnams sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs su byin gyis brlabs te rnam par bsam pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad du rdul phra rab kyi tshogs @165b ni de rnams sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs su byin gyis brlabs te rnam par bsam pa'o //
translated: In all the realm of space, the collection of atoms, one should bless them as the forms of the Buddhas and imagine them.

original: rang gi snying du bcug na ni //
analyzed: rang gi snying du bcug na ni //
translated: If one places them in one’s heart,

original: yid kyis legs pa'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: yid kyis legs pa'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: with the proper application of the mind,

original: dza: h'um bam ho: bzhi brjod cing //
analyzed: dza: h'um bam ho: bzhi brjod cing //
translated: reciting the four, jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ,

original: lus la sangs rgyas kun gzhug go //
analyzed: lus la sangs rgyas kun gzhug go //
translated: one should cause all the Buddhas to enter one’s body.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: bsgoms pa'i las kyi 'bras bu 'di gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i las kyi 'bras bu 'di gang yin zhe na /
translated: If one asks, “What is the result of the action of meditation?”🔽The text says,

original: ci ste 'dod na tshe 'di la //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ci ste 'dod na tshe 'di la //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If one desires, in this life,

original: sgrub pa po gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig tshe 'di la zhi ba dam pa mchog tu gyur pa gang gi tshe 'dod na bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid ni de'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa po gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig tshe 'di la zhi ba dam pa mchog tu gyur pa gang gi tshe 'dod na bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid ni de'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: If any practitioner at all desires the supreme, excellent peace in this life, then buddhahood, which is the abandonment of the afflictions together with their traces, is its result.

original: 'di ni bsgoms pa'i las kyi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bsgoms pa'i las kyi 'bras bu'o //
translated: This is the result of the action of meditation.

original: ci ste mi 'dod gzhan grub bzhin //
analyzed: ci ste mi 'dod gzhan grub bzhin //
translated: If one does not desire that, one should accomplish another.

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te de ltar mi bsgom na rtsa ba'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i sangs rgyas cig sgom par byed na de'i dngos grub tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te de ltar mi bsgom na rtsa ba'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i sangs rgyas cig sgom par byed na de'i dngos grub tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not meditate in this way, if one meditates on a buddha as taught in the Root Tantra, that will be one’s spiritual power.

original: de las gzhan dur nam par snang mdzad lta bu /
analyzed: de las gzhan dur nam par snang mdzad lta bu /
translated: Other than that, one should meditate on Vairocana,

original: yang na don yod grub pa'i bar lta bu gzhan dag go //
analyzed: yang na don yod grub pa'i bar lta bu gzhan dag go //
translated: or else on Amoghasiddhi.

original: gal te mi 'dod pa ni gzhan rnam par snang mdzad nas don yod grub pa'i bar mi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gal te mi 'dod pa ni gzhan rnam par snang mdzad nas don yod grub pa'i bar mi 'dod pa'o //
translated: If one does not desire that, one should meditate on another, from Vairocana to Amoghasiddhi.

original: ji skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: ji skad ston pa yin te /
translated: As it is said,

original: byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa rnam par snang mdzad du bdag nyid du bskyed pa nas /
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa rnam par snang mdzad du bdag nyid du bskyed pa nas /
translated: one should generate oneself into Vairocana through consecration and so forth,

original: don yod grub pa'i bar du bskyed de /
analyzed: don yod grub pa'i bar du bskyed de /
translated: Generate the other [deities] up to Amoghasiddhi.

original: rnal 'byor chen po dang lnga pas de'i phyag rgya chen po bcings te /🔽badzra dh'a tu zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi spyi'i snying po'am /
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po dang lnga pas de'i phyag rgya chen po bcings te / badzra dh'a tu zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi spyi'i snying po'am /
translated: With the five great yogas, bind the great seal of that [Amoghasiddhi].🔽With the words vajra dhatu [recite] the essence mantra of all the tathagatas,

original: aom sarbba ta th'a ga ta ma h'a yo ge shva ra h'um /🔽aom badzra satva h'um /
analyzed: aom sarbba ta th'a ga ta ma h'a yo ge shva ra h'um / aom badzra satva h'um /
translated: or [recite] om sarva tathagata maha yoga-svara ha hum,🔽om vajra sattva hum,

original: aom badzra ratna h'um /🔽aom badzra dharmma h'um /
analyzed: aom badzra ratna h'um / aom badzra dharmma h'um /
translated: om vajra ratna hum,🔽om vajra dharma hum,

original: aom badzra karmma h'um /
analyzed: aom badzra karmma h'um /
translated: om vajra karma hum.

original: zhes bya ba rang gi sngags de dag brjod cing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba rang gi sngags de dag brjod cing /
translated: Reciting these individual mantras,

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du nyin re zhing thun bzhi'i sbyor ba bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du nyin re zhing thun bzhi'i sbyor ba bya'o //
translated: one should perform the yoga of the four sessions each day, with oneself in the aspect of Vairochana, and so forth.

original: ji srid du bdag nyid mngon sum lta bur nyin re zhing thun bzhir mthong bar gyur pa de srid du bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid du bdag nyid mngon sum lta bur nyin re zhing thun bzhir mthong bar gyur pa de srid du bya'o //
translated: One should do this until one sees oneself in the aspect of Vairochana, and so forth, in the four sessions each day, as if in actuality.

original: de nas nam mkha'i khams thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi gzugs bsams la de nas ci nus pas /
analyzed: de nas nam mkha'i khams thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi gzugs bsams la de nas ci nus pas /
translated: Then, having contemplated the form of the Buddha throughout the realm of space, one should then recite as much as possible:

original: sarbba buddha bhi ba sva bh'a ba aa ham /
analyzed: sarbba buddha bhi ba sva bh'a ba aa ham /
translated: sarva buddhabhisambhava svabhava aham.

original: zhes nga rgyal bskyed par bya'o ;
analyzed: zhes nga rgyal bskyed par bya'o ;
translated: One should generate pride in this way.

original: / de nas ji srid du skyo bar ma gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bsgoms la de nas bsgoms pa las ldang ba'i dus su dza: h'um bam ho: brjod cing /
analyzed: / de nas ji srid du skyo bar ma gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bsgoms la de nas bsgoms pa las ldang ba'i dus su dza: h'um bam ho: brjod cing /
translated: Then, as long as one does not become weary, one should meditate. Then, at the time of rising from meditation, one should say jḥḥṃ vaṃ hoḥ,

original: yid kyis legs so sbyor bas de rnams rang gi lus la gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: yid kyis legs so sbyor bas de rnams rang gi lus la gzhug par bya'o //
translated: and with the mental application of “excellent,” one should cause them to enter one’s body.

original: yi ge brgya pas kyang brtan par byas te ldang bar bya'o //🔽de ltar nyin re zhing snga @166a * //
analyzed: yi ge brgya pas kyang brtan par byas te ldang bar bya'o // de ltar nyin re zhing snga @166a * //
translated: One should rise, having stabilized with the hundred-syllable mantra.

original: ma bzhin bsgoms nas ji srid du sangs rgyas kyi gzugs brnyan gyis nam mkha'i khams thams cad du mthong bar gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ma bzhin bsgoms nas ji srid du sangs rgyas kyi gzugs brnyan gyis nam mkha'i khams thams cad du mthong bar gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: In this way, having meditated as before each day, one should meditate for as long as one sees the forms of the buddhas in the entire realm of space.

original: de nas mtshan thog thag bsgoms na de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas mtshan thog thag bsgoms na de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, if one meditates throughout the night, one will become a tathāgata.

original: phyag rgya chen po bcings nas ni //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po bcings nas ni //
translated: Having formed the great seal,

original: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor dang / de las bshad pa'i rnal 'byor chen po byas la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor dang / de las bshad pa'i rnal 'byor chen po byas la /
translated: This is the yoga of Vajrasattva as explained in the great mandala of the Vajra Element, and the great yoga as explained therein.

original: sgeg mo la sogs pa dang / las kyi dkyil 'khor las bshad pa'i mchod pa bcu drug gis yang dag par mchod la ;
analyzed: sgeg mo la sogs pa dang / las kyi dkyil 'khor las bshad pa'i mchod pa bcu drug gis yang dag par mchod la ;
translated: Then, having made perfect offerings with the sixteen offerings explained in the Action Tantra, such as the goddess of charm and so forth,

original: de nas rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen po nas rdo rje 'bebs pa'i phyag rgya chen po'i bar du bcings te bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen po nas rdo rje 'bebs pa'i phyag rgya chen po'i bar du bcings te bsgom par bya'o //
translated: then one should bind the great seal of Vajrasattva, and meditate on it, up to the great seal of Vajra-Amogha.

original: snga ma bzhin du ji srid du rang gi sems dpa'i phyag rgya bdag nyid mngon sum lta bur gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du ji srid du rang gi sems dpa'i phyag rgya bdag nyid mngon sum lta bur gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: As before, one should meditate until one's seal-being appears as if in actuality.

original: phyag rgya chen po bcings nas ji ltar sems dpa'i sbyor ba bsgom par bya zhe na /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po bcings nas ji ltar sems dpa'i sbyor ba bsgom par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one meditate on the yoga of the seal-being, having bound the great seal?

original: de nyid chen po brjod bya ste //
analyzed: de nyid chen po brjod bya ste //
translated: The great reality is to be expressed.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus he says.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' nas rdo rje 'bebs pa'i bar du aom badzra sa tva h'um zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' nas rdo rje 'bebs pa'i bar du aom badzra sa tva h'um zhes bya ba nas /
translated: From Vajrasattva to Vajra Acyuta, one should recite the mantras of Vajrasattva and so forth, Om Vajrasattva Hum, and so forth,

original: aom badzra a'a be sha aa: zhes bya ba'i bar du rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sngags brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: aom badzra a'a be sha aa: zhes bya ba'i bar du rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sngags brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: up to Om Vajra Acyuta Ah.

original: de nas rang gi lus la lha thams cad kyi rang bzhin bdag yin no zhes bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rang gi lus la lha thams cad kyi rang bzhin bdag yin no zhes bsam par bya'o //
translated: Then one should think, I am the nature of all the deities in my body.

original: rang gi lus las rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i rnam par snang mdzad nas rdo rje 'bebs pa'i bar du sprul la /
analyzed: rang gi lus las rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i rnam par snang mdzad nas rdo rje 'bebs pa'i bar du sprul la /
translated: From one's body, one should emanate Vairocana up to Vajra Acyuta, as explained in the Great Mandala of the Vajra Realm,

original: rig pa'i rgyal po dang / khro bo'i tshogs dang / pho nya dang / bran dang / btsun mo la sogs pa dang / sems can dang / snod kyi 'jig rten thams cad sprul nas /
analyzed: rig pa'i rgyal po dang / khro bo'i tshogs dang / pho nya dang / bran dang / btsun mo la sogs pa dang / sems can dang / snod kyi 'jig rten thams cad sprul nas /
translated: and the assembly of knowledge kings, wrathful ones, messengers, servants, queens, and so forth, as well as all sentient beings and the world vessel.🔽 Then one should think, I am the nature of all the deities in my body.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i gzugs ni bdag yin no zhes tshig re rer thams cad bdag yin no zhes nga rgyal bskyed nas bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i gzugs ni bdag yin no zhes tshig re rer thams cad bdag yin no zhes nga rgyal bskyed nas bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate, generating the pride I am the form of Vairochana, etc., in each word.

original: bsgoms pa'i las kyi 'bras bu gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i las kyi 'bras bu gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the result of the action of meditation?

original: ci ste 'dod na bdag nyid des //🔽des bya gzi can dge ba yi //
analyzed: ci ste 'dod na bdag nyid des // des bya gzi can dge ba yi //
translated: If one wishes, by that one🔽attains the state of the powerful, the virtuous,

original: go 'phang tshe 'di nyid la thob //
analyzed: go 'phang tshe 'di nyid la thob //
translated: in this very life.

original: mi 'dod dngos grub gong ma bzhin //
analyzed: mi 'dod dngos grub gong ma bzhin //
translated: If one does not wish, the power is like before.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: One should understand that the practitioner🔽attains the state of the nature of Great Vajradhara

original: sgrub pa po gang yin pas tshe 'di nyid la'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa po gang yin pas tshe 'di nyid la'o //
translated: in this very life.

original: gzi can zhes bya ba ni 'od @166b zer can no //
analyzed: gzi can zhes bya ba ni 'od @166b zer can no //
translated: The powerful is Marichi.

original: byang chub pa'i rang bzhin can gyi sems dpa' la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub pa'i rang bzhin can gyi sems dpa' la sogs pa'o //
translated: The virtuous is the Bodhisattva, etc.

original: go 'phang ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: go 'phang ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The state is the nature of Great Vajradhara.

original: gal te de ltar bsgom par mi 'dod na gong du bshad pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i gzugs nyid 'ba' zhig bsgom pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te de ltar bsgom par mi 'dod na gong du bshad pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i gzugs nyid 'ba' zhig bsgom pa de'i tshe /
translated: If one does not wish to meditate in that way, then at the time of meditating on the form of Vajrasattva, etc., as explained above,

original: de bsgoms pas 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bsgoms pas 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: One will succeed by cultivating that.

original: rdzu 'phrul che stobs gzugs mchog rnams //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul che stobs gzugs mchog rnams //
translated: Those of great magical power, supreme form,

original: rdo rje sems sogs 'dra bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rdo rje sems sogs 'dra bar 'gyur //
translated: will become like Vajrasattva and so forth.

original: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: This means that one will become like Vajrasattva and so forth.

original: de'i don ni 'di skad ston pa yin te /🔽rdo rje dbyings las bshad pa'i rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor bya ba nas /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di skad ston pa yin te / rdo rje dbyings las bshad pa'i rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor bya ba nas /
translated: The meaning of this is taught as follows.🔽One should cultivate the yoga of Vajrasattva as explained in the Vajra Element

original: rdo rje 'bebs pa'i rnal 'byor bya ba'i bar ji srid bdag nyid kyis mngon sum du mthong bar gyur gyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'bebs pa'i rnal 'byor bya ba'i bar ji srid bdag nyid kyis mngon sum du mthong bar gyur gyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Tantra, and so forth, up to the yoga of Vajra Subduer, until one sees it directly.

original: de nas brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad rang gi lus las sprul te /
analyzed: de nas brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad rang gi lus las sprul te /
translated: Then, having emanated all things, moving and unmoving, from one's own body,

original: de'i rang bzhin bdag yin no zhes nga rgyal bskyed nas ji srid du brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos por bdag nyid mngon sum du mthong bar gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin bdag yin no zhes nga rgyal bskyed nas ji srid du brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos por bdag nyid mngon sum du mthong bar gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: one should cultivate that until one sees oneself directly as all things, moving and unmoving, having generated the pride that one is their nature.

original: de nas mtshan thog thag par bsgoms na rdo rje 'chang chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas mtshan thog thag par bsgoms na rdo rje 'chang chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, if one meditates throughout the night, one becomes Great Vajradhara.

original: de ltar 'gyur ba ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur ba ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How does one know that this is so?

original: gcig gi ngo bo brtan par byas te /
analyzed: gcig gi ngo bo brtan par byas te /
translated: Having stabilized the nature of one,

original: phyi nas tshig rer thams cad bdag yin par zhes bya ba smos te bsgoms pas so //
analyzed: phyi nas tshig rer thams cad bdag yin par zhes bya ba smos te bsgoms pas so //
translated: then, after that, one should meditate on all as being the self,

original: brtan par gyur nas spro par bya //🔽brtan par ma gyur de mi spro //
analyzed: brtan par gyur nas spro par bya // brtan par ma gyur de mi spro //
translated: and when one has become stable, one should emanate.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: One should not emanate if one is not stable.

original: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The word “then” is as before.

original: dam tshig 'dzin pa'i phyag rgya ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya ste /🔽rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa ston pa'o //
analyzed: dam tshig 'dzin pa'i phyag rgya ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya ste / rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa ston pa'o //
translated: The pledge seal is the pledge seal of Vairochana, etc.

original: de'i dam pa'i dngos grub ni de rnams kyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang byang chub sems dpa' nyid thob bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i dam pa'i dngos grub ni de rnams kyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang byang chub sems dpa' nyid thob bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The supreme attainment of that is the attainment of the pledge seal of those, i.e., of Vairochana, etc., and of the state of a bodhisattva.

original: ji ltar rdo rje 'dzin grub pa ni rnam par snang mdzad chen po dang / de bzhin nyid dang / rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rdo rje 'dzin chen po'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rdo rje 'dzin grub pa ni rnam par snang mdzad chen po dang / de bzhin nyid dang / rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rdo rje 'dzin chen po'o //
translated: The accomplishment of the vajra holder is the Great Vairochana, the Suchness, and the Great Vajradhara.

original: dngos grub ni de bzhin nyid du ro gcig par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dngos grub ni de bzhin nyid du ro gcig par gyur pa'o //
translated: The power is the oneness of taste with Suchness.

original: de ltar bdag ces bsgoms nas ni //
analyzed: de ltar bdag ces bsgoms nas ni //
translated: Thus, having meditated on the self,

original: zhes bya ba ni yang dang yang mngon du byas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yang dang yang mngon du byas pa'o //
translated: means that one should repeatedly manifest it.

original: sangs rgyas dang ni gzi chen thob //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang ni gzi chen thob //
translated: One attains Buddhahood and great splendor

original: ces bya ba ni rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid thob pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid thob pa'o //
translated: means that one attains the state of Great Vajradhara.

original: mi 'dod dngos grub gong ma bzhin //
analyzed: mi 'dod dngos grub gong ma bzhin //
translated: The power is not desired, as before,

original: zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //🔽'di skad @167a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no // 'di skad @167a * //
translated: means as previously explained.

original: ston pa yin te /🔽snga ma bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnal 'byor ram /
analyzed: ston pa yin te / snga ma bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnal 'byor ram /
translated: This is what is taught:🔽Having performed the yoga of Vairochana and so forth, the Tathagatas,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams kyi rnal 'byor byas te /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams kyi rnal 'byor byas te /
translated: or the yoga of Vajrasattva and so forth,

original: gzugs brnyan la sogs pa dang mtshungs par bdag nyid bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan la sogs pa dang mtshungs par bdag nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: one should meditate on oneself as being equal to a reflection and so forth.

original: rang gi dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings te /🔽rang gi snying po dang sngags brjod cing snga ma bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
analyzed: rang gi dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings te / rang gi snying po dang sngags brjod cing snga ma bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
translated: Having formed one's pledge seal,🔽one should recite one's essence mantra and mantra, and meditate until one sees oneself as like a reflection of the Tathagata or Vajrasattva, etc.,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs par bdag nyid mngon sum lta bur mthong ba de srid du bsgom par bya'o //🔽de nas snga ma bzhin du spro ba dang bsdu ba'i sbyor bas ji srid thams cad kyi rang bzhin nam /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs par bdag nyid mngon sum lta bur mthong ba de srid du bsgom par bya'o // de nas snga ma bzhin du spro ba dang bsdu ba'i sbyor bas ji srid thams cad kyi rang bzhin nam /
translated: as if in the presence of the deity.🔽Then, as before, by the yoga of emanating and reabsorbing, one should meditate until one sees in space the nature of all things,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nam mkha' la mngon sum du mthong bar gyur pa de srid du bsgom par bya'o //🔽de nas mtshan thog thag bsgoms nas de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nam mkha' la mngon sum du mthong bar gyur pa de srid du bsgom par bya'o // de nas mtshan thog thag bsgoms nas de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
translated: or the nature of Vajrasattva, etc.,

original: rdo rje 'chang bar bdag nyid 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang bar bdag nyid 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, having meditated throughout the night, one becomes the Tathagata or Vajradhara.

original: chos kyi phyag rgya dam pa'i dngos grub ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' nyid thob pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi phyag rgya dam pa'i dngos grub ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' nyid thob pa'o //
translated: The attainment of the excellent Dharma seal is the attainment of Buddhahood and the state of a Bodhisattva.

original: chos rnams thams cad rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad rang bzhin gyis //
translated: All phenomena are by nature

original: dag ces brjod na nges par yang //
analyzed: dag ces brjod na nges par yang //
translated: If one says “pure,” it is certainly so.

original: zhes bya ba ni don dam par na dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba'i badzra dzny'a na nas garbha aa aa: zhes bya ba'i bar gyi chos kyi yi ge'i ngo bo brjod cing smras pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni don dam par na dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba'i badzra dzny'a na nas garbha aa aa: zhes bya ba'i bar gyi chos kyi yi ge'i ngo bo brjod cing smras pa'o //
translated: This is the statement and expression of the reality of the Dharma syllables from vajra jñāna up to garbha āḥ.

original: ci tsam zhig rang bzhin gyis dag par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci tsam zhig rang bzhin gyis dag par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: To what extent is there purity by nature?

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said “all phenomena.”

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad do //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad do //
translated: All phenomena are compounded and uncompounded.

original: rang bzhin gyis dag pa ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dag pa ni stong pa nyid do //
translated: Purity by nature is emptiness.

original: chos kyi yi ge'i ngo bo brjod pa ni smras pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi yi ge'i ngo bo brjod pa ni smras pa'o //
translated: The statement is the expression of the reality of the Dharma syllables.

original: sangs rgyas sam byang chub sems dpa' thob par 'gyur ro //🔽snga ma bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnal 'byor ram /
analyzed: sangs rgyas sam byang chub sems dpa' thob par 'gyur ro // snga ma bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnal 'byor ram /
translated: One will attain buddhahood or the stage of a bodhisattva.🔽As before, one should perform the yoga of the Tathāgata

original: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor byas la /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor byas la /
translated: or the yoga of Vajrasattva and so forth.

original: snga ma bzhin du lce la badzra dzny'a na la sogs pa chos kyi yi ge rnam par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du lce la badzra dzny'a na la sogs pa chos kyi yi ge rnam par bsam par bya'o //
translated: As before, one should imagine the letters of the Dharma, beginning with vajra jñāna, on the tongue.

original: phyis rang gi snying gar rdo rje rtse lnga pa de rnam par bkod na /
analyzed: phyis rang gi snying gar rdo rje rtse lnga pa de rnam par bkod na /
translated: Later, having arranged those five-pronged vajras in one’s heart,

original: de rdo rje'i tshig gis brjod cing /
analyzed: de rdo rje'i tshig gis brjod cing /
translated: one should recite the vajra words.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang / rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan snang ba tsam gyis rnam par dag par bdag nyid bsgoms te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang / rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan snang ba tsam gyis rnam par dag par bdag nyid bsgoms te /
translated: One should meditate on oneself as pure by the mere appearance of the image of the Tathāgata, Vajrasattva, and so forth.

original: ji srid du de'i ngo bor bdag nyid mngon sum du mthong bar gyur pa de srid du bsgom par bya'o //🔽de nas snga ma bzhin du ji srid du spro ba dang bsdu ba'i sbyor bas nam mkha'i khams thams cad @167b du de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag nyid dam /
analyzed: ji srid du de'i ngo bor bdag nyid mngon sum du mthong bar gyur pa de srid du bsgom par bya'o // de nas snga ma bzhin du ji srid du spro ba dang bsdu ba'i sbyor bas nam mkha'i khams thams cad @167b du de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag nyid dam /
translated: One should meditate for as long as one sees oneself in that form.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du mthong bar gyur pa de srid du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du mthong bar gyur pa de srid du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, as before, for as long as one sees the entire realm of space as the nature of the Tathāgata or the nature of Vajrasattva, and so forth, through the yoga of emanating and gathering, one should meditate.

original: de nas de bzhin du bsgrubs na de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
analyzed: de nas de bzhin du bsgrubs na de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
translated: Then, if one accomplishes it in that way, one will become the Tathāgata or

original: las kyi phyag rgya rnams kyi dam pa'i dngos grub ni las kyi phyag rgya ni dam pa'i dngos grub bo //
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya rnams kyi dam pa'i dngos grub ni las kyi phyag rgya ni dam pa'i dngos grub bo //
translated: The supreme attainment of the karmamudra is the supreme attainment of the karmamudra.

original: thams cad kyi ni kun dag par //🔽zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dang / yongs su sbyong ba dang / so sor rtog pa dang / sgrub pa lhur len pa'i brtson 'grus kyi mtshan nyid dang / sems can gyi don du sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i mdzad pa'i sgeg mo la sogs pa'i chod pa brgyad dang /
analyzed: thams cad kyi ni kun dag par // zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dang / yongs su sbyong ba dang / so sor rtog pa dang / sgrub pa lhur len pa'i brtson 'grus kyi mtshan nyid dang / sems can gyi don du sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i mdzad pa'i sgeg mo la sogs pa'i chod pa brgyad dang /
translated: All of them are purified.

original: las kyi dkyil 'khor las bshad pa'i mchod pa bcu drug gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: las kyi dkyil 'khor las bshad pa'i mchod pa bcu drug gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the nature of the eight goddesses beginning with Lalita, who are the emanations of the Buddha for the sake of sentient beings, and the sixteen offerings explained in the Karmamandala, which are the characteristics of the striving of application, purification, discernment, and accomplishment.

original: las rnams thams cad sbyangs nas ni //
analyzed: las rnams thams cad sbyangs nas ni //
translated: Having purified all karma,

original: zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pas thams cad rnam par sbyangs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pas thams cad rnam par sbyangs pa'o //
translated: this is the perfection of striving of natural luminosity, which purifies everything.

original: de'i phyir kun nas kun du rnam par dag pa'i phyir las rnams thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su sbyor ba'i las thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal pa'i sgyu ma dang mtshungs par bsgoms pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir kun nas kun du rnam par dag pa'i phyir las rnams thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su sbyor ba'i las thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal pa'i sgyu ma dang mtshungs par bsgoms pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since all actions are completely and totally pure, all actions are thoroughly purified just as they are, and all are meditated on as being like illusions, naturally luminous.

original: bsgoms pas cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: bsgoms pas cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the result of meditation?

original: sangs rgyas gzi chen thob ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas gzi chen thob ces bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, “one attains the great splendor of buddhahood.”

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: snga ma bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnal 'byor ram /🔽de'i rigs kyi rnal 'byor byas la /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnal 'byor ram / de'i rigs kyi rnal 'byor byas la /
translated: As before, one should perform the yoga of Vairochana and so forth, or the yoga of their clans.

original: sgeg mo la sogs pa rnams dang / las kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i mchod pa rnams kyis yang dag par mchod la /
analyzed: sgeg mo la sogs pa rnams dang / las kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i mchod pa rnams kyis yang dag par mchod la /
translated: Then, having made perfect offerings with the offerings of Charm and so forth, and the offerings taught in the Action Mandala,

original: de'i las kyi phyag rgya bcings te /
analyzed: de'i las kyi phyag rgya bcings te /
translated: one should bind the action seal,

original: rang gi snying gar sna tshogs rdo rje rnam par bsams nas /
analyzed: rang gi snying gar sna tshogs rdo rje rnam par bsams nas /
translated: and imagine a variegated vajra at one’s heart.

original: de'i steng du snying po'am sngags rang gi yid kyis bris la /
analyzed: de'i steng du snying po'am sngags rang gi yid kyis bris la /
translated: On top of that, one should write the essence-mantra or the mantra with one’s mind.

original: de'i snying po'am sngags rdo rje'i tshig gis brjod cing /🔽rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i snang brnyan tsam du de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
analyzed: de'i snying po'am sngags rdo rje'i tshig gis brjod cing / rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i snang brnyan tsam du de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
translated: Reciting the essence mantra or vajra words,🔽one should meditate on the image as merely the clear light nature of the Tathāgata,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du ji srid bdag nyid mthong bar gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du ji srid bdag nyid mthong bar gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: or as having the nature of Vajrasattva, and so on, for as long as one sees oneself in that way.

original: de nas snga ma bzhin du thams cad kun du khyab par rnam par bsams la /
analyzed: de nas snga ma bzhin du thams cad kun du khyab par rnam par bsams la /
