analyzed: yi ge h'um la sogs pa'i chos kyi phyag rgya mchog / yang dang yang mngon du byas na gzi brjid can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu gsungs @169b pa'o ;
translated: If one repeatedly actualizes the supreme Dharma, the Dharma seal of the letter hūṃ, etc., one will become radiant. This is the result.

original: / snga ma bzhin du thams cad byas la /
analyzed: / snga ma bzhin du thams cad byas la /
translated: Having done everything as before,

original: chos kyi phyag rgya lce la yid kyis bris nas rdo rje rtse lnga pa dkar po lce la rnam par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi phyag rgya lce la yid kyis bris nas rdo rje rtse lnga pa dkar po lce la rnam par bsam par bya'o //
translated: one should write the Dharma seal on the tongue with the mind, and imagine a white five-pronged vajra on the tongue.

original: rang gi snying ga'i rdo rje la yang de mngon par bris la de nyid brjod cing gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs pa'i rdo rje rigs kyi rang bzhin bdag nyid kyi phyag rgya chen po'i sbyor bas bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi snying ga'i rdo rje la yang de mngon par bris la de nyid brjod cing gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs pa'i rdo rje rigs kyi rang bzhin bdag nyid kyi phyag rgya chen po'i sbyor bas bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should also write that on the vajra at one’s heart, and reciting that, one should meditate on the great seal of one’s own nature, which is the nature of the Vajra family, by the yoga of the great seal, which is like a reflection.

original: snga ma bzhin du mtshan thog thag bsgoms na de'i rjes la rdo rje 'chang chen por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du mtshan thog thag bsgoms na de'i rjes la rdo rje 'chang chen por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If one meditates on that throughout the night as before, then after that one will become like Great Vajradhara. This is the meaning.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The phrase then, etc. is as before.

original: dge ba'am yang na mi dge ba //
analyzed: dge ba'am yang na mi dge ba //
translated: Whether virtuous or nonvirtuous,

original: gang gis las rnams byas pa ni //
analyzed: gang gis las rnams byas pa ni //
translated: whatever actions are performed,

original: zhes bya ba ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ;
translated: the text says.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa la phul ba la zhi ba'i las kyi sbyor ba 'di ni dge ba'i las so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa la phul ba la zhi ba'i las kyi sbyor ba 'di ni dge ba'i las so //
translated: The application of the rite of peace to what is offered to the buddhas, etc. is a virtuous action.

original: rnam par 'tshe ba ni mi dge ba'i las so //
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba ni mi dge ba'i las so //
translated: Violence is a nonvirtuous action.

original: khro ba ni mi dge ba'i las nyid du grags pa'i phyir 'jig rten las grags pa de ltar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: khro ba ni mi dge ba'i las nyid du grags pa'i phyir 'jig rten las grags pa de ltar brjod par bya'o //
translated: Anger is a nonvirtuous action, well known in the world.

original: 'di ltar dge ba dan mi dge bas cung zad byed pa de dag thams cad rnal 'byor pas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar dge ba dan mi dge bas cung zad byed pa de dag thams cad rnal 'byor pas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, whatever virtuous or nonvirtuous actions are performed, the yogin should offer them to the tathāgatas.

original: phul bas ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: phul bas ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What will come of that offering?

original: skad cig gis ni gzi can 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: skad cig gis ni gzi can 'gyur // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He will become radiant in an instant.

original: de'i don ni 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: snga ma bzhin du gang gi khro bo'i rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor chen po byas la mchod pa thams cad kyis yang dag par mchod de /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du gang gi khro bo'i rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor chen po byas la mchod pa thams cad kyis yang dag par mchod de /
translated: As before, having performed the yoga and great yoga of one's wrathful deity, make offerings with all offerings.

original: rang gi khro bo'i las kyi phyag rgya ji lta ba bzhin du bcings nas rang gi snying gar sna tshogs rdo rje la sngags zlos shing yid kyis bkod la /
analyzed: rang gi khro bo'i las kyi phyag rgya ji lta ba bzhin du bcings nas rang gi snying gar sna tshogs rdo rje la sngags zlos shing yid kyis bkod la /
translated: Binding one's wrathful karma consort as before, one should recite the mantra at one's heart center on a crossed vajra, mentally arranging it.

original: de nyid brjod cing nam mkha'i khams thams cad du snga ma bzhin du rdo rje'i rigs kyis bkang nas lha chen po la sogs pa'i gdug pa thams cad 'dul ba dang / zhi ba rnams rjes su gzung ba la sogs pa de rnam par bsams te /
analyzed: de nyid brjod cing nam mkha'i khams thams cad du snga ma bzhin du rdo rje'i rigs kyis bkang nas lha chen po la sogs pa'i gdug pa thams cad 'dul ba dang / zhi ba rnams rjes su gzung ba la sogs pa de rnam par bsams te /
translated: Reciting that, one should imagine that the entire realm of space is filled with the vajra family as before, subduing all the wicked, such as the great gods, and so on, and benefiting those who are peaceful, and so on.

original: de rang rang gi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin du byas nas /
analyzed: de rang rang gi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin du byas nas /
translated: Having made them all the nature of all tathagatas,

original: bdag gis gdug pa gdul ba la sogs pa'i las 'di mdzod cig ces gsol ba btab nas /
analyzed: bdag gis gdug pa gdul ba la sogs pa'i las 'di mdzod cig ces gsol ba btab nas /
translated: one should request them, “Please perform the activity of subduing the wicked, and so on.”

original: de ltar de rnams la dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las rnams phul bar bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar de rnams la dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las rnams phul bar bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should meditate on the offering of virtuous and non-virtuous actions to them.

original: de nas snga ma bzhin du mtshan thog thag bsgoms la bsgrubs na ji srid mngon sum du mthong ba de srid kyi bar du bsgoms na /
analyzed: de nas snga ma bzhin du mtshan thog thag bsgoms la bsgrubs na ji srid mngon sum du mthong ba de srid kyi bar du bsgoms na /
translated: Then, as before, one should meditate throughout the night and practice. If one meditates until one sees them directly,

original: de skad cig gis gzi brjid can du 'gyur ro//
analyzed: de skad cig gis gzi brjid can du 'gyur ro//
translated: in an instant one will become radiant.

original: @170a * // 'dod chags ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: @170a * // 'dod chags ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Passion is the perfection of wisdom.

original: chos la bdag med mkhas pa yis //
analyzed: chos la bdag med mkhas pa yis //
translated: The wise one who is skilled in the selflessness of phenomena

original: 'dir goms pa 'di chags pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir goms pa 'di chags pa'o //
translated: is passionate about this meditation here.

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus it is explained.

original: de dag pa ni dri ma thams cad dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de dag pa ni dri ma thams cad dang bral ba'o //
translated: Purity is freedom from all stains.

original: 'di ltar 'di dag pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di dag pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is this pure?

original: ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said to be by nature.

original: ngo bo nyid ni sgro 'dogs pa med pa gnyug ma'i bdag nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid dmigs pa med pa'i thugs rje chen po'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni sgro 'dogs pa med pa gnyug ma'i bdag nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid dmigs pa med pa'i thugs rje chen po'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The essence is the characteristic of the perfection of wisdom, which is the absence of reification, the innate nature, free from the concepts of subject and object, and the great compassion that is without reference.

original: de las byung ba ni 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ni 'dod chags te ;
analyzed: de las byung ba ni 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ni 'dod chags te ;
translated: Arisen from that is Avalokiteśvara, who is passion.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i 'dod chags de la mu stegs can gyis smad par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i 'dod chags de la mu stegs can gyis smad par gyur pa'o //
translated: That passion, which is such, is despised by the tīrthikas.

original: de la mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyud la 'jug pa'i thabs kyis las dang ldan pa de la spyir mu stegs zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de la mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyud la 'jug pa'i thabs kyis las dang ldan pa de la spyir mu stegs zhes brjod do //
translated: In that regard, the one who is endowed with the means of engaging in the continuum of nirvāṇa is generally called a tīrthika.

original: sangs rgyas pa'i theg pa chen po spong ba'i lam gzhan 'di ni mu stegs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa'i theg pa chen po spong ba'i lam gzhan 'di ni mu stegs te /
translated: This other path that abandons the Mahāyāna of the Buddhists is a tīrtha.

original: de gang la yod pa de ni mu stegs can no //
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de ni mu stegs can no //
translated: One who has that is a tīrthika.

original: de yod pas na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'o //
analyzed: de yod pas na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'o //
translated: Because of that, there is the vehicle of the hearers and solitary realizers.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam la zhugs pa 'di bden snyam du rmongs pa'i mu stegs can gyis smod pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam la zhugs pa 'di bden snyam du rmongs pa'i mu stegs can gyis smod pa'o //
translated: The tīrthikas, who are deluded and think that this mundane path is true, disparage it.

original: de la chags pa'i chos 'di ni //
analyzed: de la chags pa'i chos 'di ni //
translated: This Dharma of attachment

original: zhes bya ba ni de lta bur gyur pa de gnyi ga'i bdag nyid dag pa'i 'dod chags de la shin tu chags pas yang dang yang mngon du byas pa 'di ni theg pa chen po ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de lta bur gyur pa de gnyi ga'i bdag nyid dag pa'i 'dod chags de la shin tu chags pas yang dang yang mngon du byas pa 'di ni theg pa chen po ste /
translated: is the Great Vehicle,

original: rdo rje theg pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rdo rje theg pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: the nature of the Vajra Vehicle.

original: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba ste /
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba ste /
translated: The word “only” is for the sake of emphasis.

original: 'di kho na theg pa chen po'i chos yin no zhes rim pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di kho na theg pa chen po'i chos yin no zhes rim pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This alone is the Dharma of the Great Vehicle.

original: gang gi phyir chos 'di rnal 'byor pa sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyi dngos grub 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos 'di rnal 'byor pa sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyi dngos grub 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This Dharma is for the sake of accomplishing the spiritual powers of the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught.🔽The yoga of Subjugating the Three Worlds, as explained in the great maṇḍala of Subjugating the Three Worlds,

original: 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i 'gro ba 'dul ba'i rnal 'byor ram /
analyzed: 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i 'gro ba 'dul ba'i rnal 'byor ram /
translated: or the yoga of Subjugating the Three Worlds, as explained in the great maṇḍala of Subjugating the Three Worlds,

original: de'i rigs kyi rnal 'byor de dang de las bshad pa'i rnal 'byor chen po byas la /
analyzed: de'i rigs kyi rnal 'byor de dang de las bshad pa'i rnal 'byor chen po byas la /
translated: Having performed the great yoga explained in that and other yogas of that type,

original: padma'i sgeg mo la sogs pa dang / padma'i rigs kyi las kyi dkyil 'khor las bshad pa'i mchod pa bcu drug gis bdag nyid yang dag par mchod la /
analyzed: padma'i sgeg mo la sogs pa dang / padma'i rigs kyi las kyi dkyil 'khor las bshad pa'i mchod pa bcu drug gis bdag nyid yang dag par mchod la /
translated: one should perfectly worship oneself with the sixteen offerings explained in the Padma Lotus family karma mandala, such as the lotus dancer and so forth.

original: phyag bzhis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la phyag byas te 'gro ba 'dul ba'i phyag rgya chen po'am /
analyzed: phyag bzhis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la phyag byas te 'gro ba 'dul ba'i phyag rgya chen po'am /
translated: Having made obeisance to all the Tathagatas with four prostrations, one should form the great mudra of Subduing Migrators or

original: sangs rgyas padma la sogs pa de'i @170b rigs kyi phyag rgya chen po bcings te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas padma la sogs pa de'i @170b rigs kyi phyag rgya chen po bcings te /
translated: the great mudra of that family, such as Buddha Padma and so forth.

original: chos bdag la chags pa'i rang bzhin gyi snang brnyan tsam 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug tu bdag nyid bsams te /🔽rang gi snying ga'i padma'i rdo rje la sngags bzlas shing bkod do //
analyzed: chos bdag la chags pa'i rang bzhin gyi snang brnyan tsam 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug tu bdag nyid bsams te / rang gi snying ga'i padma'i rdo rje la sngags bzlas shing bkod do //
translated: One should imagine oneself as the nature of mere appearance of the Dharma, which is attached to oneself, as the noble Avalokitesvara.🔽One should recite the mantra and arrange it on the vajra of the lotus of one's heart.

original: nam mkha' thams cad padma'i rigs kyis dgang bar bsams la rang gi sngas brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' thams cad padma'i rigs kyis dgang bar bsams la rang gi sngas brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that the entire sky is filled with the lotus family and recite one's own mantra.

original: 'jig rten dbang phyug tu bdag nyid bsgoms nas ji srid bdag nyid de'i gzugs su mngon sum lta bur mthong bar gyur pa de nyid kyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang phyug tu bdag nyid bsgoms nas ji srid bdag nyid de'i gzugs su mngon sum lta bur mthong bar gyur pa de nyid kyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Having meditated on oneself as the Lord of the World, one should meditate until one sees oneself in the form of that Lord as if in a vision.

original: de nas padma'i rigs kyi ngo bos thams cad du khyab par ji srid bdag nyid kyis mthong bar gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas padma'i rigs kyi ngo bos thams cad du khyab par ji srid bdag nyid kyis mthong bar gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, by the nature of the Lotus Family, one should meditate until one sees oneself pervaded everywhere.

original: de'i rjes la snga ma bzhin yang dang yang du bsgrubs na 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes la snga ma bzhin yang dang yang du bsgrubs na 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: After that, if one accomplishes again and again as before, one becomes the very Lord Avalokitdvara.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: Then, etc. has been explained.

original: ting 'dzin brtan pa'i tshul gyis ni //🔽byams pa chen po bsgoms nas kyang ;
analyzed: ting 'dzin brtan pa'i tshul gyis ni // byams pa chen po bsgoms nas kyang ;
translated: By the method of firm samadhi

original: / zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba la /

original: bsgoms pas ni yang dang yang mngon du byas pa'o //
analyzed: bsgoms pas ni yang dang yang mngon du byas pa'o //
translated: By meditating, one makes it manifest again and again.

original: ci zhig goms par byed ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig goms par byed ce na /
translated: What is one meditating on?

original: ci ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar bya zhe na /
translated: What is one doing?

original: ting 'dzin brtan pa'i tshul gyis ni //
analyzed: ting 'dzin brtan pa'i tshul gyis ni //
translated: By the method of firm samadhi.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is stated.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa'o //
translated: Concentration is the one-pointedness of mind.

original: de nyid brtan pa'i tshul gyis ni mi shigs ba'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid brtan pa'i tshul gyis ni mi shigs ba'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: That itself is the practice of indestructibility by the method of stability.

original: ting nge 'dzin brtan par gyur nas spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin brtan par gyur nas spro bar bya'o //
translated: Having become stable in concentration, one should expand.

original: byams pa chen po de phyogs bcur bkang bar ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: byams pa chen po de phyogs bcur bkang bar ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: How does one fill the ten directions with that great love?

analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /

original: byams pa bsgom pa'i man ngag gis te /
analyzed: byams pa bsgom pa'i man ngag gis te /

analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i man ngag gis spro bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should expand by the instruction explained previously.

analyzed: ldan zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin bzang po dang ldan pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Endowed means endowed with good concentration.

original: bsgoms pa des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: bsgoms pa des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What happens by that cultivation?

original: skad cig gis ni gzi can thob //
analyzed: skad cig gis ni gzi can thob //
translated: In an instant one attains the radiant.

original: ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ces bya ba smos so //
translated: This is what is said.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin / te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin / te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: snga ma bzhin du 'jig rten dbang phyug gi sbyor bas rnal 'byor chen po byas te /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du 'jig rten dbang phyug gi sbyor bas rnal 'byor chen po byas te /
translated: Having performed the great yoga by the application of Lokeśvara as before,

original: mchod pa dang phyag bya ba rjes su spyad la /
analyzed: mchod pa dang phyag bya ba rjes su spyad la /
translated: having performed the worship and prostration,

original: rang gi dam tshig gi phyag rgyas bcings te /
analyzed: rang gi dam tshig gi phyag rgyas bcings te /
translated: One should bind with one’s pledge seal,

analyzed: rang gi snying ga'i zla ba la gnas pa'i rdo rje padma la snying po bkod pa nyid brjod cing /

original: sems can gyi khams thams cad la byams pa chen po spros te /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams thams cad la byams pa chen po spros te /
translated: One should emanate great love to the entire realm of sentient beings,

original: padma'i rigs kyi gzugs su rnam par bsams la /🔽rang @171a * //
analyzed: padma'i rigs kyi gzugs su rnam par bsams la / rang @171a * //
translated: and imagine oneself in the form of the Lotus family.🔽One should imagine oneself as before,

original: bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i snang brnyan tsam du bdag nyid snga ma bzhin du bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i snang brnyan tsam du bdag nyid snga ma bzhin du bsam par bya'o //
translated: as a mere reflection, pure by nature.

original: de nas mtshan thog thag bsgoms la de'i rjes la nam mkha' thams cad padma'i rigs kyis yongs su gang bar mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas mtshan thog thag bsgoms la de'i rjes la nam mkha' thams cad padma'i rigs kyis yongs su gang bar mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, having meditated throughout the night, one will see the entire sky filled with the Lotus family.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: “ Then” is as before, and so on.

original: 'dod chags ngo bo nyid kyis dag / ces bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis dag pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs nas ngo bo nyid kyis dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags ngo bo nyid kyis dag / ces bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis dag pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs nas ngo bo nyid kyis dag pa'o //
translated: “ Passion is pure by nature” means that purity by nature is pure by nature, having abandoned the concepts of grasped and grasper.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis dag pa de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis dag pa de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that purity by its very essence?

original: 'dod chags zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'dod chags zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, “attachment.”
