analyzed: 'dod pa gang yin pa de chags pa yang yin pas na de 'dod chags so //
translated: That which is desired is also attachment, so that is attachment.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i chags pa chos bdag med pa'i chags pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i chags pa chos bdag med pa'i chags pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: All phenomena are pure by nature. The ultimate attachment is the attachment to the selflessness of phenomena.

original: smra bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni ji lta ba'i yi ge hr'i: la sogs pa padma'i rigs kyis chos kyi yi ge brjod pa'o //
analyzed: smra bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni ji lta ba'i yi ge hr'i: la sogs pa padma'i rigs kyis chos kyi yi ge brjod pa'o //
translated: “ Speech” refers to the speech of the lotus family, such as the syllable hrīḥ, which expresses the Dharma syllables.

original: ci zhig smra zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig smra zhe na /
translated: What is it that is spoken?

original: tshul 'di ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: tshul 'di ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, “this method.”

original: chos bdag med pa la shin tu chags pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir tshul yin te /
analyzed: chos bdag med pa la shin tu chags pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir tshul yin te /
translated: The attachment to the selflessness of phenomena is the method, because it is the cause for attaining perfect buddhahood.

original: smra bar gyur pa'i tshul 'di zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: smra bar gyur pa'i tshul 'di zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the “speech of the method.”

original: de ltar 'di smras pas ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar 'di smras pas ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What happens by speaking in this way?

original: 'dod chags pha rol phyin rnyed de //
analyzed: 'dod chags pha rol phyin rnyed de //
translated: Having attained the perfection of passion,

original: skad cig gis ni gzi can thob //
analyzed: skad cig gis ni gzi can thob //
translated: in an instant he becomes the radiant one.

original: ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smos te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: 'dod chags kyi pha rol tu son pas na 'dod chags kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi pha rol tu son pas na 'dod chags kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: Having gone to the other side of passion, he is the perfection of passion.

original: chos bdag med pa mngon du bya ba de thob pas na 'dod chags kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnyed par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: chos bdag med pa mngon du bya ba de thob pas na 'dod chags kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnyed par gyur pa'o //
translated: Having attained that which is the realization of the selflessness of phenomena, he has attained the perfection of passion.

original: skad cig ma de nyid la 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma de nyid la 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: In that very instant he becomes the noble Avalokiteśvara.

original: de'i don ni 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is taught as follows.

original: snga ma bzhin du 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i rang nyid kyis 'jig rten dbang phyug gi rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor chen po byas la /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i rang nyid kyis 'jig rten dbang phyug gi rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor chen po byas la /
translated: As before, having performed the yoga and great yoga of Lokeśvara in the great maṇḍala of Vinayaka,

original: cho ga thams cad rjes su spyad de /
analyzed: cho ga thams cad rjes su spyad de /
translated: having performed all the rites,

original: lce la rdo rje dkar po rnam par bsams te /
analyzed: lce la rdo rje dkar po rnam par bsams te /
translated: one should visualize a white vajra on the tongue.

original: yi ge hi la sogs pa'i chos kyi yi ge lce'i dbus su dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge hi la sogs pa'i chos kyi yi ge lce'i dbus su dgod par bya'o //
translated: One should place the letters of the Dharma, such as the letter hi, in the middle of the tongue.

original: yang snying ga'i rdo rje padma nyi ma nyid la chos kyi yi ge rnam par bsams la /
analyzed: yang snying ga'i rdo rje padma nyi ma nyid la chos kyi yi ge rnam par bsams la /
translated: Again, one should visualize the Dharma syllables on the vajra, lotus, and sun at the heart,

original: de brjod cing chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya bas /
analyzed: de brjod cing chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya bas /
translated: and recite them, thinking, “All phenomena are pure by nature.”

original: rang gi lha'i gzugs snang @171b brnyan tsam du bsams la /
analyzed: rang gi lha'i gzugs snang @171b brnyan tsam du bsams la /
translated: One should visualize one’s deity as merely an appearance,

original: padma'i rigs kyis nam mkha'i khams thams cad gang bar snga ma bzhin du bsgoms na gdon mi za bar 'jig rten dbang phyug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: padma'i rigs kyis nam mkha'i khams thams cad gang bar snga ma bzhin du bsgoms na gdon mi za bar 'jig rten dbang phyug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: and meditate on the lotus family filling the whole realm of space, as before. One will certainly become the Lord of the World.

original: de nas las kyi phyag rgya dam pa'i dngos grub kyi rgyud ces bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas las kyi phyag rgya dam pa'i dngos grub kyi rgyud ces bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Next, the tantra called “The Tantra of the Attainment of the True Action Seal” and so forth is the same as before.

original: bdag gis ba lha dang reg pa dang ; / zhes bya ba ni sems can 'ga' zhig gis 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba tsam gyis sdig pa thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gis ba lha dang reg pa dang ; / zhes bya ba ni sems can 'ga' zhig gis 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba tsam gyis sdig pa thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “I am the deity, touched by the deity” means that by merely seeing the noble Avalokiteśvara as he is, one will be freed from all evil.

original: 'phags pa nor bzangs bzhin du 'ga' zhig gis reg pa tsam gyis sam /🔽'ga' zhig ges mtshan nyan pa tsam gyis sam /
analyzed: 'phags pa nor bzangs bzhin du 'ga' zhig gis reg pa tsam gyis sam / 'ga' zhig ges mtshan nyan pa tsam gyis sam /
translated: Like the noble Sudhana, some are freed from the suffering of being killed or bound, etc. , merely by being touched by him.🔽Some are freed merely by hearing his name.

original: dran pa tsam gyis kyang gsod pa dang / 'ching ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran pa tsam gyis kyang gsod pa dang / 'ching ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Some are freed merely by remembering him.

original: de nas bdag nyid sems can thams cad du 'gyur ba yin no zhes bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bdag nyid sems can thams cad du 'gyur ba yin no zhes bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then one should meditate on oneself as all sentient beings.

original: bsgoms pas ci zhig byed ce na //
analyzed: bsgoms pas ci zhig byed ce na //
translated: What is the use of meditating on that?🔽It is said:

original: sdug bsngal kun gyi mthar byed 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun gyi mthar byed 'gyur // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It brings an end to all suffering.

original: sdug bsngal yang yin la kun yang de yin pas na sdug bsngal kun te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang yin la kun yang de yin pas na sdug bsngal kun te /
translated: Suffering is all of it, therefore it is all suffering.🔽Since it removes those things that torment sentient beings, it is like the end of all suffering.

original: sems can rnams kyi gdung bar byed pa'i ngo bo de dag sel bar byed pa de'i phyir sdug bsngal kun gyis mthar byed pa bzhin bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug de skad bshad pa bzhin du gnas par 'dod na bdag de lta bur bya'o
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi gdung bar byed pa'i ngo bo de dag sel bar byed pa de'i phyir sdug bsngal kun gyis mthar byed pa bzhin bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug de skad bshad pa bzhin du gnas par 'dod na bdag de lta bur bya'o
translated: If one wishes to abide as explained, one should be like that.

original: // 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: // 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: snga ma bzhin du rang nyid spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi rnal 'byor gyis thams cad rjes su spyad pa'i phyir rang gi las kyi phyag rgya bcings te /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du rang nyid spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi rnal 'byor gyis thams cad rjes su spyad pa'i phyir rang gi las kyi phyag rgya bcings te /
translated: As before, having performed the yoga of Avalokiteśvara, one should bind one’s action seal,

original: snying ga'i zla ba la hr'i: las sna tshogs padma rgya gram rnam par bsams la de'i steng du bzlas pa'i snying po bkod de /
analyzed: snying ga'i zla ba la hr'i: las sna tshogs padma rgya gram rnam par bsams la de'i steng du bzlas pa'i snying po bkod de /
translated: and imagine a moon at the heart, a multicolored lotus, and a cross, and on that the essence of the mantra.

original: zlos shing phyogs bcu ra 'jig rten dbang po'i gzugs kyis sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi sdug bsngal bas la nas padma'i rigs kyi ngo bor rnam par bsams te /
analyzed: zlos shing phyogs bcu ra 'jig rten dbang po'i gzugs kyis sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi sdug bsngal bas la nas padma'i rigs kyi ngo bor rnam par bsams te /
translated: Reciting, one imagines that in the world systems of the ten directions all sentient beings are freed from suffering by the form of Lokeśvara, and that they are imagined to be of the nature of the lotus family.

original: sarbba ai ba aa ham zhes nga rgyal bskyed nas rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i snang brnyan tsam de'i rang bzhin bdag yin no zhes bsgo par byas la /
analyzed: sarbba ai ba aa ham zhes nga rgyal bskyed nas rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i snang brnyan tsam de'i rang bzhin bdag yin no zhes bsgo par byas la /
translated: Having generated the pride “I am all beings,” one should imagine that one is of the nature of the mere appearance of natural luminosity.

original: snga ma bzhin du bsgrubs na de'i rjes la skad cig de nyid la 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du bsgrubs na de'i rjes la skad cig de nyid la 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If one accomplishes it as before, then immediately after that, in that very instant, one becomes the Noble Avalokiteśvara.

original: nor bu'i rigs kyi don thams cad grub pa la @172a * //
analyzed: nor bu'i rigs kyi don thams cad grub pa la @172a * //
translated: In the Jewel family, all aims are accomplished,

original: sogs pa nas rin chen 'bebs pa'i mthar thug pa'i dam pa'i dngos grub de'i phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'grub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sogs pa nas rin chen 'bebs pa'i mthar thug pa'i dam pa'i dngos grub de'i phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'grub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and so on, up to the supreme attainment of Ratnapāṇi. The result of the great seal, and so on, is accomplished. This is the meaning.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni dmigs kyis dgar ba'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni dmigs kyis dgar ba'o //
translated: Here is a specification.

original: phyag rgya chen po'i dam pa'i dngos grub de ston bar byed pa'i sgra'i tshogs la yang rgyud ces bya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i dam pa'i dngos grub de ston bar byed pa'i sgra'i tshogs la yang rgyud ces bya'o //
translated: The collection of words that teach the supreme attainment of the great seal is also called a tantra.

original: sangs rgyas kun dbang bdag gyur zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kun gyis dbang bskur ba'i nor bu'i rigs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun dbang bdag gyur zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kun gyis dbang bskur ba'i nor bu'i rigs so //
translated: The line I become empowered by all buddhas refers to the Jewel family, which is empowered by all buddhas.

original: de bdag go zhes bya ba bsgoms pa ni bdag 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bdag go zhes bya ba bsgoms pa ni bdag 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meditation on I am that means I become that.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du bya zhe na /
translated: How is it to be done?

original: rdo rje snying po ji bzhin du //
analyzed: rdo rje snying po ji bzhin du //
translated: Just like the essence of the vajra.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: ji ltar nor bu'i rigs kyi snying po bsgoms pa de bzhin du bdag nyid kyang bya'o zhes bya ba ni ji bzhin du'o //
analyzed: ji ltar nor bu'i rigs kyi snying po bsgoms pa de bzhin du bdag nyid kyang bya'o zhes bya ba ni ji bzhin du'o //
translated: Just as the essence of the jewel family is cultivated, so should one cultivate oneself.

original: bsgom par bya ba rnam bsgoms na //
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba rnam bsgoms na //
translated: Having cultivated what is to be cultivated,

original: zhes bya ba ni nor bu'i rigs de yang dang yang mngon du byas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nor bu'i rigs de yang dang yang mngon du byas pa'o //
translated: that jewel family is repeatedly manifested.

original: na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba ste /
analyzed: na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba ste /
translated: The word na is for emphasis.

original: yang dang yang mngon du byas pa'o //
analyzed: yang dang yang mngon du byas pa'o //
translated: It is repeatedly manifested.

original: ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What happens then?

original: skad cig gis ni gzi can thob //
analyzed: skad cig gis ni gzi can thob //
translated: In an instant, one attains brilliance.

original: ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ces bya ba smos so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de'i don ni 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is taught as follows:

original: don thams cad grub pa'i dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i rang 'dod pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor dang / de las bshad pa'i rnal 'byor chen po byas la rin chen sgeg mo la sogs pa rnams dang / nor bu'i rigs kyi las kyi dkyil 'khor las bshad pa'i mchod pa bcu drug gis bdag nyid yang dag par mchod de /
analyzed: don thams cad grub pa'i dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i rang 'dod pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor dang / de las bshad pa'i rnal 'byor chen po byas la rin chen sgeg mo la sogs pa rnams dang / nor bu'i rigs kyi las kyi dkyil 'khor las bshad pa'i mchod pa bcu drug gis bdag nyid yang dag par mchod de /
translated: Having performed the yoga of one's desired deity explained in the great maṇḍala of Sarva­pavitra­saṃpada, and having performed the great yoga explained in that [tantra], one should make perfect offerings to oneself with Ratnālaṃkāra and so on, and the sixteen offerings explained in the Ratna-family activity maṇḍala.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la phyag bzhi byas te langs la rang gi lta ba'i phyag rgya chen po bcings te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la phyag bzhi byas te langs la rang gi lta ba'i phyag rgya chen po bcings te /
translated: Having made four prostrations to all tathāgatas, one should arise and bind the great mudra of one's view.

original: rang gi snying po brjod cing de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pas sems can gyi khams thams cad nor bu'i rigs kyi dbang bskur bas dbang bskur te /
analyzed: rang gi snying po brjod cing de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pas sems can gyi khams thams cad nor bu'i rigs kyi dbang bskur bas dbang bskur te /
translated: Reciting one's essence, one should imagine that all realms of sentient beings are empowered by the empowerment of the Ratna family, and so on, by all tathāgatas and so on.

original: nor bu'i rigs kyi rang bzhin du rnam par bsams te /
analyzed: nor bu'i rigs kyi rang bzhin du rnam par bsams te /
translated: Imagining that they are transformed into the nature of the Ratna family,

original: lha thams cad nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'i snang brnyan tsam ni bdag yin no zhes nga rgyal bskyed de ;
analyzed: lha thams cad nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'i snang brnyan tsam ni bdag yin no zhes nga rgyal bskyed de ;
translated: one should generate pride, thinking, “I am all deities, mere reflections equal to space.”

original: ji srid bdag nyid rang gi lha'i rang bzhin du mngon sum lta bur gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bsgoms na bdag nyid de'i rang bzhin du mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji srid bdag nyid rang gi lha'i rang bzhin du mngon sum lta bur gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bsgoms na bdag nyid de'i rang bzhin du mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: As long as one meditates on oneself as having the nature of one's deity, as if in a direct perception, one will see oneself as having that nature.

original: de nas nor bu'i rigs thams cad du song bar ji srid du mngon sum lta bur gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas nor bu'i rigs thams cad du song bar ji srid du mngon sum lta bur gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, having gone to all the jewel clans, one should meditate as long as one has a direct perception of them.🔽Then, having meditated throughout the night, one will see them in a direct perception after that.

original: de nas mtshan @172b thog thag bsgoms na de'i rjes la mngon sum du mthong bar gyur pa dang / de nas skad cig de nyid la rdo rje snying por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas mtshan @172b thog thag bsgoms na de'i rjes la mngon sum du mthong bar gyur pa dang / de nas skad cig de nyid la rdo rje snying por 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, in that very instant, one becomes the essence of the vajra.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //🔽yongs su rdzogs par byed 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no // yongs su rdzogs par byed 'gyur zhing //
translated: Then, etc. , is as before.🔽One will be perfected.

original: zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid gyur cing bsgoms pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid gyur cing bsgoms pa'o //
translated: One will be means one will become and one will meditate.

original: ci ltar 'gyur zhing zhe na /🔽sems can kun gyi re ba kun //
analyzed: ci ltar 'gyur zhing zhe na / sems can kun gyi re ba kun //
translated: How will it be?

original: yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //🔽zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: One will fulfill the hopes of all sentient beings.

original: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What will it be like?

original: nam mkha'i snying po 'dra ba ni //
analyzed: nam mkha'i snying po 'dra ba ni //
translated: Like the heart of the sky.

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de bzhin du 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying pos sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa de bzhin du 'dir yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying pos sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa de bzhin du 'dir yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Just as the noble Akashagarbha fulfills the wishes of all sentient beings, so it is here also. This is the meaning.

original: de ltar bsgrubs pas ci zhig thob par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar bsgrubs pas ci zhig thob par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is attained by accomplishing it thus?

original: skad cig gis ni gzhi can thob //
analyzed: skad cig gis ni gzhi can thob //
translated: In an instant, the basis is attained.

original: ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: skad cig ma de nyid la rdo rje snying po thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skad cig ma de nyid la rdo rje snying po thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In that very instant, the essence of the vajra is attained. This is the meaning.

original: snga ma bzhin du thams cad byas nas dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings nas /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du thams cad byas nas dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings nas /
translated: Having done everything as before, form the pledge seal,

original: rang gi snying ga'i rdo rje rgya gram gyi dbus su bzlas pa'i snying po yid kyis bris te /
analyzed: rang gi snying ga'i rdo rje rgya gram gyi dbus su bzlas pa'i snying po yid kyis bris te /
translated: and mentally write the essence of the recitation in the center of the vajra cross at one's heart.

original: de nyid brjod cing nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa thams cad dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad la dbang bskur nas nor bu'i rigs kyi rang bzhin du bsams te /
analyzed: de nyid brjod cing nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa thams cad dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad la dbang bskur nas nor bu'i rigs kyi rang bzhin du bsams te /
translated: Having conferred empowerment upon all the Tathagatas, etc., and the entire realm of sentient beings with the gnosis of the equality of space, one should imagine the nature of the jewel lineage.

original: nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'i so sor snang ba ni bdag yin no zhes nor bu'i rigs thams cad kyis nga rgyal bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'i so sor snang ba ni bdag yin no zhes nor bu'i rigs thams cad kyis nga rgyal bskyed par bya'o //
translated: One should generate the pride of I am the self-appearance equal to space, with the pride of the entire jewel lineage.

original: de bzhin du rnam par bsgoms nas de nas nam mkha' thams cad nor bu'i rang bzhin du mthong na /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par bsgoms nas de nas nam mkha' thams cad nor bu'i rang bzhin du mthong na /
translated: Having thus meditated, then, if one sees all space as the nature of the jewel,

original: de nas skad cig de nyid la rdo rje snying po dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas skad cig de nyid la rdo rje snying po dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then in that very moment one becomes like the essence of the vajra.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bshad zin to //
translated: Then, etc. has been explained before.

original: bdag nyid kyang zhes bya ba ni nor bu'i rigs zlos pa ni nor bu'i rigs kyi bdag nyid kyi nor sbyin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang zhes bya ba ni nor bu'i rigs zlos pa ni nor bu'i rigs kyi bdag nyid kyi nor sbyin no //
translated: One's own self means that one who recites the jewel lineage is the giver of jewels, the nature of the jewel lineage.

original: kyang zhes bya ba ni nges par gzung ba ste /
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba ni nges par gzung ba ste /
translated: The word also is a restriction.

original: de'i bdag kho na'i nor spangs nas sems can rnams la gtong ba de dag de dag gi rang bzhin du mos pa de'i phyir /🔽nor sbyin dag tu dga' byed cing //
analyzed: de'i bdag kho na'i nor spangs nas sems can rnams la gtong ba de dag de dag gi rang bzhin du mos pa de'i phyir / nor sbyin dag tu dga' byed cing //
translated: Having abandoned the wealth of just that self, one should imagine that one gives it to sentient beings.🔽One should delight in giving wealth,

original: zhes bya ba la rab btu dga byed ni shin tu dga' bar byed pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la rab btu dga byed ni shin tu dga' bar byed pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: in the nature of delighting in giving.

original: ci zhig byed cing zhe na /🔽chos 'byung ba'i chos kyi rang bzhin gyis chos kyi phyag rgya ni yi ge tra la sogs pa'i rang @173a * //
analyzed: ci zhig byed cing zhe na / chos 'byung ba'i chos kyi rang bzhin gyis chos kyi phyag rgya ni yi ge tra la sogs pa'i rang @173a * //
translated: What does one do?🔽The Dharma mudra is the expression of the nature of the syllable tra, etc.,

original: bzhin brjod pa'o //🔽gzi can tshe 'di nyid la tho ba //
analyzed: bzhin brjod pa'o // gzi can tshe 'di nyid la tho ba //
translated: which is the nature of the Dharma that arises from the Dharma.

original: ces bya ba ni rdo rje snying po thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rdo rje snying po thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: One who is powerful obtains the vajra essence in this very life.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: snga ma bzhin du don thams cad grub pa'i rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor chen po byas te /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du don thams cad grub pa'i rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor chen po byas te /
translated: As before, one should perform the yoga and the great yoga of Sarvarthasiddhi.

original: mchod pa thams cad kyis yang dag par mchod de /
analyzed: mchod pa thams cad kyis yang dag par mchod de /
translated: Having made offerings with all offerings,

original: phyag byas te snga ma bzhin du rang gi lce la chos kyi yi ge rnam par bsams te /
analyzed: phyag byas te snga ma bzhin du rang gi lce la chos kyi yi ge rnam par bsams te /
translated: having made obeisance, as before one should imagine the Dharma syllable on one's tongue.

original: de nyid las rang gi snying gar sna tshogs rdo rje rnam par bsams te /
analyzed: de nyid las rang gi snying gar sna tshogs rdo rje rnam par bsams te /
translated: In that very place, one should imagine a variegated vajra in one's heart.

original: de nyid brjod cing nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i snang brnyan tsam ni bdag yin no zhes bsgoms nas sangs rgyas thams cad la sogs pa dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad rang gi rang bzhin du byas nas //
analyzed: de nyid brjod cing nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i snang brnyan tsam ni bdag yin no zhes bsgoms nas sangs rgyas thams cad la sogs pa dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad rang gi rang bzhin du byas nas //
translated: Reciting that very [vajra] mantra, one should meditate, The mere appearance equal to space is myself. Having made all sentient beings one's own nature,

original: de'i rjes la thams cad bdag yin no zhes nga rgyal bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la thams cad bdag yin no zhes nga rgyal bskyed par bya'o //
translated: after that, one should generate the pride, All is myself.

original: de nas yi ge tra la sogs pa'i rang gi chos kyi phyag rgya zlos shing snga ma bzhin du bsgrubs nas rdo rje snying po thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas yi ge tra la sogs pa'i rang gi chos kyi phyag rgya zlos shing snga ma bzhin du bsgrubs nas rdo rje snying po thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, reciting one's own dharma-mudra beginning with the syllable tra, and accomplishing as before, one will attain the essence of vajra.

original: de nas las kyi phyag rgya dam pa'i dngos grub kyi rgyad ces bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de nas las kyi phyag rgya dam pa'i dngos grub kyi rgyad ces bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: Then, the tantra of the attainment of the excellent karma-mudra and so on have been explained.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i nor spangs pa ni dbul po'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i nor spangs pa ni dbul po'o //
translated: Poor means abandoning worldly and supramundane wealth.

original: de'i dbu la po rnams la phan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i dbu la po rnams la phan pa'i phyir /
translated: For the sake of benefiting all those heads,

original: nor bu'i rigs thob pa ni bsam pa thams cad rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: nor bu'i rigs thob pa ni bsam pa thams cad rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The attainment of the jewel family is the fulfillment of all wishes.

original: nor ni nor bu'i rigs te /
analyzed: nor ni nor bu'i rigs te /
translated: Wealth is the jewel family.

original: de bsgrub pa ni de mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bsgrub pa ni de mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: Its accomplishment is its realization.

original: de bsgoms pas de la gzhon zhing de la phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bsgoms pas de la gzhon zhing de la phyogs pa'o //
translated: By cultivating it, one becomes youthful and inclined toward it.

original: brtson pa dang ldan pa ni bsgom pa'i 'bad pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: brtson pa dang ldan pa ni bsgom pa'i 'bad pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Endowed with effort is endowed with the effort of cultivation.

original: 'bad pa dang ldan pa des gzi brjid can du gyur pa thob cing 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'bad pa dang ldan pa des gzi brjid can du gyur pa thob cing 'gro ba'o //
translated: By that effort, one becomes powerful and attains going.

original: ci ste yang /
analyzed: ci ste yang /
translated: But if

original: mi 'dod dngos grub gong ma bzhin //
analyzed: mi 'dod dngos grub gong ma bzhin //
translated: one does not wish for power, it is like the former powers.

original: zhes bya ba ni thams cad du sbyor bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thams cad du sbyor bar shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as applying in all cases.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: snga ma bzhin du don thams cad grub pa'i rnal 'byor dang / snga ma bzhin du cho ga thams cad rjes su spyad nas rang gi snying gar sna tshogs rdo rje rnam par bsams te /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du don thams cad grub pa'i rnal 'byor dang / snga ma bzhin du cho ga thams cad rjes su spyad nas rang gi snying gar sna tshogs rdo rje rnam par bsams te /
translated: As before, one should perform the yoga of all-purpose Amoghasiddhi, and as before, one should perform all the rites. Then, in one's heart, one should visualize a crossed vajra.

original: rang gi lha'i las kyi phyag rgya bcings nas snying po sna tshogs rdo rje'i dbus su yid kyis bris la /
analyzed: rang gi lha'i las kyi phyag rgya bcings nas snying po sna tshogs rdo rje'i dbus su yid kyis bris la /
translated: Having formed the karma-consort gesture of one’s deity, mentally write the essence-mantra in the center of the variegated vajra.

original: de nyid brjod cing rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba sgyu ma dang mtshungs par bdag nyid bsams te /
analyzed: de nyid brjod cing rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba sgyu ma dang mtshungs par bdag nyid bsams te /
translated: Reciting that, one should imagine oneself as the illusion-like nature of clear light.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa thams cad dang sems can gyi khams thams cad la nor bu'i rigs kyi dbang bskur bas dbang bskur te nor bu'i rigs kyi ngo bor bsgom @173b bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa thams cad dang sems can gyi khams thams cad la nor bu'i rigs kyi dbang bskur bas dbang bskur te nor bu'i rigs kyi ngo bor bsgom @173b bar bya'o //
translated: Having conferred empowerment on all the Tathāgatas and all the realms of sentient beings with the empowerment of the jewel family, one should meditate on the nature of the jewel family.

original: de'i rjes la thams cad ni bdag yin no zhes nga rgyal bskyed cing bsgoms la de nas snga ma bzhin du bsgrubs na nam mkha'i snying por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes la thams cad ni bdag yin no zhes nga rgyal bskyed cing bsgoms la de nas snga ma bzhin du bsgrubs na nam mkha'i snying por 'gyur ro //
translated: After that, one should generate pride and meditate on “all is I.” Then, if one accomplishes as before, one will become Ākāśagarbha.

original: rigs thams cad ni ji skad du bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rigs thams cad ni ji skad du bshad pa'o //
translated: All the families are as previously explained.

original: de dag gi phyag rgya rnams ni phyag rgya chen po dang / dam tshig dang / chos dang las kyi phyag rgya rnams so //
analyzed: de dag gi phyag rgya rnams ni phyag rgya chen po dang / dam tshig dang / chos dang las kyi phyag rgya rnams so //
translated: Their gestures are the great seal, the pledge seal, the doctrine seal, and the action seal.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dngos grub dam pa thob pa ni rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dngos grub dam pa thob pa ni rnyed pa'o //
translated: The attainment of the sublime spiritual powers of the buddhas and bodhisattvas is the acquisition.

original: de'i cho ga rgyas pa ni ji skad du bshad pa'i phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i bsgrub pa bye brag tu rgyas pa de ston par byed pa'i dam tshig ni rgyud do //
analyzed: de'i cho ga rgyas pa ni ji skad du bshad pa'i phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i bsgrub pa bye brag tu rgyas pa de ston par byed pa'i dam tshig ni rgyud do //
translated: The extensive ritual is the extensive particularized practice of the great seal, etc., as explained. The commitment that reveals that is the tantra.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi phyag rgya chen po dang / dam tshig dang chos dang / las kyi phyag rgya rnams kyis sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dngos grub tu 'gyur ba bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi phyag rgya chen po dang / dam tshig dang chos dang / las kyi phyag rgya rnams kyis sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dngos grub tu 'gyur ba bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the spiritual powers of the buddhas and bodhisattvas by means of the great seal, commitment, doctrine, and action seals of the Tathagata family,

original: da ni dam tshig gi dngos grub rnam par gzhag pa ni phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa bsgom pa'i bya ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dam tshig gi dngos grub rnam par gzhag pa ni phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa bsgom pa'i bya ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to explain the meaning of the practice of the great seal, etc., which is the arrangement of the spiritual powers of the commitments,

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyag na rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyag na rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Vajrapāṇi,” and so on.

original: de nas kyi sgra ni de ma thag pa brjod pa ste /
analyzed: de nas kyi sgra ni de ma thag pa brjod pa ste /
translated: The word “then” expresses immediate succession.

original: yang zhes bya ba ni zlos pa'i don te /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni zlos pa'i don te /
translated: “ Also” means “again.”

original: phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa sgom pa la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa sgom pa la ltos pa'o //
translated: It is in dependence on the meditation of the great seal, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni ji skad du bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni ji skad du bshad pa'o //
translated: “ All tathāgatas” are as previously explained.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni lnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni lnga'o //
translated: “ Tathāgata” is fivefold:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs dang / rdo rje dang / padma dang nor bu'i rigs rnams so //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyang de yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs dang / rdo rje dang / padma dang nor bu'i rigs rnams so // de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyang de yin la /
translated: the tathāgata family, the vajra family, the lotus family, and the jewel family.

original: rigs kyang de yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs so ;
analyzed: rigs kyang de yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs so ;
translated: They are all tathāgatas and they are also families, thus they are the families of all tathāgatas.

original: / de'i dam tshig ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs kyi dam tshig ste /🔽gang gis 'dod pa snyoms zhugs pa //
analyzed: / de'i dam tshig ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs kyi dam tshig ste / gang gis 'dod pa snyoms zhugs pa //
translated: Their commitments are the commitments of the families of all tathāgatas.🔽By whom one enters into union with the desired deity,

original: de 'dod pas ni sbyor bar byed /
analyzed: de 'dod pas ni sbyor bar byed /
translated: one is united with the desired deity.

original: ces bya ba ni mi 'da' ba'i don gyis dam tshig ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni mi 'da' ba'i don gyis dam tshig ste /
translated: This is the commitment in the sense of not transgressing.

original: dngos grub des phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: dngos grub des phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa bskyed pa'o //
translated: By that power, the great seal, etc. are generated.

original: de ston par byed pa'i rgyud la yang de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ston par byed pa'i rgyud la yang de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The tantra that teaches that is also called that.

original: de ya zhes bya ba ni dmigs kyis dgar ba'o //
analyzed: de ya zhes bya ba ni dmigs kyis dgar ba'o //
translated: The word “also” is a specification.

original: re zhig de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis dam tshig gi dngos grub kyi rgyud gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: re zhig de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis dam tshig gi dngos grub kyi rgyud gsungs pa ste /
translated: First, the Tathāgatas teach the Tantra of the Attainment of the Commitments:

original: 'di zhes bya ba phyis 'chad par 'gyur ba blo la gnas pa'o //🔽gang gis zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnal @174a * //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba phyis 'chad par 'gyur ba blo la gnas pa'o // gang gis zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnal @174a * //
translated: “This” is explained later, and is present in the mind.

original: 'byor pas rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa bsgom pa'i 'dod pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'byor pas rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa bsgom pa'i 'dod pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: “By whom” is the yoga of the Tathāgatas, who enter into union with the desired meditation on Vajrasattva, etc.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rnam par rtse gcig pa ni /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rnam par rtse gcig pa ni /
translated: The one-pointedness of the form of Vajrasattva, etc.

original: de la 'dod pa sbyor bar byed //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa sbyor bar byed //
translated: is “the one who joins with the desired.”

original: ces bya'o // de'i rnal 'byor pas 'dod pa la snyoms par 'jug pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa yin gyi ;
analyzed: ces bya'o // de'i rnal 'byor pas 'dod pa la snyoms par 'jug pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa yin gyi ;
translated: The yoga of that one who enters into union with the desired is Vajrasattva, etc.

original: rdo rje h'um mdzad la sogs pa khro bo'i yang ma yin la /
analyzed: rdo rje h'um mdzad la sogs pa khro bo'i yang ma yin la /
translated: It is not the wrathful Vajra Hūṃkāra, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yang ma yin zhing 'gro ba 'dul ba la sogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yang ma yin zhing 'gro ba 'dul ba la sogs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the Tathagata, nor is it the discipliner of beings, and so on.

original: de skad du ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: de skad du ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How is this known?

original: 'dod pa'i sgras ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sgras ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa brjod pa yin te /
translated: The word desire refers to Vajrasattva and so on.

original: chos kyi 'dod pa yid 'ong ba //
analyzed: chos kyi 'dod pa yid 'ong ba //
translated: The desire for Dharma is pleasing,

original: 'dod chags dam tshig ces su brjod //🔽ces 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod chags dam tshig ces su brjod // ces 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: and is called the commitment of passion.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs ni 'dod chags kyi sgras bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs ni 'dod chags kyi sgras bstan to //
translated: The Tathagata family is taught by the word passion.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: sangs rgyas phyag rgya chen po ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas phyag rgya chen po ni //
translated: the great seal of the Buddha

original: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi phyag rgya chen po ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi phyag rgya chen po ste /
translated: is the great seal of the Buddha.

original: phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i phyag rgya bzhi'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i phyag rgya bzhi'o //
translated: The four seals, such as the great seal, are the great seal and so on.

original: ye shes ni der nges pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes ni der nges pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is ascertained there.

original: de'i dam tshig ni bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i dam tshig ni bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Its commitment is the cause of its generation, because it does not pass beyond it.

original: bshad pa ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa ni bstan pa'o //
translated: The explanation is the teaching.

original: de'i don ni 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of that is taught as follows.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag rgya bcings la /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag rgya bcings la /
translated: Having formed the mudrā of the Tathāgata in the manner previously explained,

original: rang gi snying bar yid kyis rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa nges par byas la /
analyzed: rang gi snying bar yid kyis rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa nges par byas la /
translated: one should imagine Vajrasattva and so forth in one’s heart.

original: de bsgom pa la dga' ba'i sems can gyi khams rnams byang chub tu sems bskyed de rnam par sbyangs nas bya ba byas pa ni bdag yin no zhes bsams nas /
analyzed: de bsgom pa la dga' ba'i sems can gyi khams rnams byang chub tu sems bskyed de rnam par sbyangs nas bya ba byas pa ni bdag yin no zhes bsams nas /
translated: Having generated the thought of awakening in the realm of sentient beings who delight in that meditation, and having purified them, one should think, “I have done what needs to be done.”

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i gzugs su bdag nyid bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i gzugs su bdag nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then one should meditate on oneself in the form of Vairocana and so forth.

original: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni skabs su bab pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni skabs su bab pa'o //
translated: The word “then” is used in the sense of sequence.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rigs ni de bzhin gshegs pa las skyes pa'i rigs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rigs ni de bzhin gshegs pa las skyes pa'i rigs te /
translated: The family of the Tathāgatas is the family born from the Tathāgata.

original: 'di rdo rje sems dpa' nas brtsams nas rdo rje 'bebs pa'i mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rdo rje sems dpa' nas brtsams nas rdo rje 'bebs pa'i mthar thug pa'o //
translated: It begins with Vajrasattva and ends with Vajra Acala.

original: de'i dam tshig gi dngos grub kyi rgyud bshad pa ni ston pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dam tshig gi dngos grub kyi rgyud bshad pa ni ston pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the tantra of the spiritual powers of the commitments of that family is the teaching.

original: 'dod pa rnams zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa nas rdo rje 'bebs pa'i mthar thug pa la 'dod par bya ba de skad bshad do //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa nas rdo rje 'bebs pa'i mthar thug pa la 'dod par bya ba de skad bshad do //
translated: The desires are said to be the Vajrasattvas, etc., up to the Vajra-Summoner.

original: 'dod pa ni bcom ldan 'das de nyid sems dpa' ste zhes 'byung bas /
analyzed: 'dod pa ni bcom ldan 'das de nyid sems dpa' ste zhes 'byung bas /
translated: The desire is the Lord himself, the hero.

original: de dag la chags pa dang ma bral ba dang / mngon du phyogs pa dang / shin tu sred pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la chags pa dang ma bral ba dang / mngon du phyogs pa dang / shin tu sred pa'o //
translated: Thus, the attachment is the non-separation from them, the facing is the intense longing.

original: rnal 'byor bas de dag la shin tu chags pa bsgom pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnal 'byor bas de dag la shin tu chags pa bsgom pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The cultivation is the yogi's intense attachment to them.🔽 This is the meaning of the verse.

original: dam tshig shin tu tshul chen 'di //
analyzed: dam tshig shin tu tshul chen 'di //
translated: This pledge, the great way,

original: zhes bya ba ni thams cad song bas na tshul chen no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thams cad song bas na tshul chen no //
translated: is the great way because it goes everywhere.

original: gang gi rigs las she na /
analyzed: gang gi rigs las she na /
translated: What is its family?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i @174b rigs zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i @174b rigs zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: It is said to be the Tathagata family.

original: cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is its result?

original: dag pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dag pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said to be purity.

original: chags pa la sogs spangs pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa la sogs spangs pa'o //
translated: It is the abandonment of attachment, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di la /
translated: For that very reason,

original: rgyal bas kyang ni 'da' mi mdzad //
analyzed: rgyal bas kyang ni 'da' mi mdzad //
translated: the Victorious Ones do not go beyond it.🔽 🔽The Victorious Ones are the Buddhas.

original: ces bya'o // de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyang sgom pa dang 'da' bar mi mdzad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ces bya'o // de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyang sgom pa dang 'da' bar mi mdzad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And since they are the nature of the Tathagatas, all the Tathagatas do not pass beyond meditation.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rigs kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis rang gi phyag rgya bcings te /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rigs kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis rang gi phyag rgya bcings te /
translated: The yogis of the Vajrasattva and other families, having bound their own seals in the manner previously explained,

original: rang gi lha la shin tu chags pa'i sgom pas bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi lha la shin tu chags pa'i sgom pas bsgom par bya'o //
translated: should meditate with meditation that is very attached to their own deity.

original: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Then, the word “then” is as before.

original: rdo rje h'um mdzad nas brtsams nas khro bo rdo rje 'bebs pa'i mthar thug pa ni 'dir rdo rje'i rigs so //
analyzed: rdo rje h'um mdzad nas brtsams nas khro bo rdo rje 'bebs pa'i mthar thug pa ni 'dir rdo rje'i rigs so //
translated: The Vajra family here begins with Vajra Humkara and ends with the wrathful Vajra Acala.

original: de'i dam tshig ni rang gi lha'i de'i bdag nyid du bsgom par mos pa'i rnal 'byor pa des dngos grub kyi sbyor ba de la mngon par dga' bas rang gi khro bo'i phyag rgya chen por bskyed la /
analyzed: de'i dam tshig ni rang gi lha'i de'i bdag nyid du bsgom par mos pa'i rnal 'byor pa des dngos grub kyi sbyor ba de la mngon par dga' bas rang gi khro bo'i phyag rgya chen por bskyed la /
translated: The pledge of that is the yoga of the practitioner who imagines himself to be of the nature of his deity, and who delights in the application of the powers, generating himself as the great seal of his own wrathful deity.

original: de ston par byed pa'i rgyud bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de ston par byed pa'i rgyud bshad pa'o //
translated: The tantra that teaches that is explained.

original: sems can don du khro min yang //
analyzed: sems can don du khro min yang //
translated: Even though he is not wrathful for the sake of sentient beings,

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di la khro ba mi mnga' yang khro bo'i rnal 'byor pas sems can dang sems can ma yin pa la gnod pa rnams la khro ba lta bur gyur pa yin yang de la nyon mongs pa mi mnga'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di la khro ba mi mnga' yang khro bo'i rnal 'byor pas sems can dang sems can ma yin pa la gnod pa rnams la khro ba lta bur gyur pa yin yang de la nyon mongs pa mi mnga'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning is that even though he is not wrathful in this world, the wrathful yogi is like one who is wrathful toward those who harm sentient beings and those who are not sentient beings, but he is not afflicted by afflictions.

original: de'i khro bo ma yin pa yang rdo rje h'um mdzad la sogs pa nas rdo rje 'bebs pa'i mthar thug pa'i khro bo'i rnal 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: de'i khro bo ma yin pa yang rdo rje h'um mdzad la sogs pa nas rdo rje 'bebs pa'i mthar thug pa'i khro bo'i rnal 'byor pa'o //
translated: His wrath is from Vajra Humkara up to Vajra Acyuta, the wrathful yogi.

original: yang gi sgra ni nges par gzung ba'o //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni nges par gzung ba'o //
translated: The word “even” is for emphasis.

original: zhe sdang mi mnga' ba yin yang sems can gdug cing ma rung ba rnams gdul ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhe sdang mi mnga' ba yin yang sems can gdug cing ma rung ba rnams gdul ba'i phyir /
translated: Although he is without hatred,

original: rang rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa 'joms pa'i sems can gyi don du'o //
analyzed: rang rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa 'joms pa'i sems can gyi don du'o //
translated: he is for the sake of sentient beings, in order to subdue the wicked and unruly.

original: khro bo chen po rab tu ston //
analyzed: khro bo chen po rab tu ston //
translated: He displays the great wrath,

original: zhes bya ba ni chos bdag med pa las byung bas sems can dang sems can ma yin pa la gnod pa rab tu ston pa ni khro bo chen po rab tu ston pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos bdag med pa las byung bas sems can dang sems can ma yin pa la gnod pa rab tu ston pa ni khro bo chen po rab tu ston pa ste /
translated: because he arises from the reality of the selflessness of phenomena, he displays the great wrath, which is the harm to sentient beings and non-sentient beings.

original: rdo rje'i rigs kyi nam mkha' khyab par bsgoms pa ni chen po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje'i rigs kyi nam mkha' khyab par bsgoms pa ni chen po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The great means that he meditates on the pervasion of the sky with the vajra family.

original: 'di gang gi rigs la ngam tshig yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di gang gi rigs la ngam tshig yin zhe na /
translated: To which family does this belong?

original: rdo rje'i rigs ni chen po yis //
analyzed: rdo rje'i rigs ni chen po yis //
translated: The great vajra family,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /🔽rdo rje chen po dang / byang chub kyi sems chen po bskyed pa'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa 'bar @175a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te / rdo rje chen po dang / byang chub kyi sems chen po bskyed pa'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa 'bar @175a * //
translated: he says.🔽The great vajra is the five-pronged blazing vajra that arises from the great mind of enlightenment.

original: ba'i rdo rje chen po'i rigs ni de las byung ba ste /
analyzed: ba'i rdo rje chen po'i rigs ni de las byung ba ste /
translated: The great vajra family arises from that.

original: rdo rje h'um mdzad la sogs pa nas rdo rje 'bebs pa'i mthar thug pa'i rdo rje'i rigs thams cad kyi rdo rje chen po'i rigs te /
analyzed: rdo rje h'um mdzad la sogs pa nas rdo rje 'bebs pa'i mthar thug pa'i rdo rje'i rigs thams cad kyi rdo rje chen po'i rigs te /
translated: The great vajra family of all the vajra families, from Vajrahūṃkāra up to Vajra-Amogha.

original: 'di'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba'o //
translated: The word “only” here has the sense of restriction.

original: dam tshig 'di ni 'da' bar dka' //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dam tshig 'di ni 'da' bar dka' // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This pledge is hard to transgress.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /🔽snga ma bzhin du rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi rnal 'byor dang / rnal 'byor chen po'am /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te / snga ma bzhin du rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi rnal 'byor dang / rnal 'byor chen po'am /
translated: This is what is being taught:🔽As before, one should perform the yoga of Vajrahūṃkāra, the great yoga,

original: de'i rigs kyi rnal 'byor byas la /
analyzed: de'i rigs kyi rnal 'byor byas la /
translated: or the yoga of his family.

original: cho ga thams cad rjes su spyad de /
analyzed: cho ga thams cad rjes su spyad de /
translated: Having performed all the rites,

original: chos bdag med pa'i rnal 'byor chen po'i rigs las byung ba'i rdo rje rigs kyis nam mkha'i khams thams cad bkang la /
analyzed: chos bdag med pa'i rnal 'byor chen po'i rigs las byung ba'i rdo rje rigs kyis nam mkha'i khams thams cad bkang la /
translated: one should fill the whole realm of space with the vajra family, which arises from the great yoga of the emptiness of phenomena,

original: sgyu ma lta bu thams cad du khyab pa'i rigs su bdag nyid kyis shin tu rtse gcig par bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i sgra ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu thams cad du khyab pa'i rigs su bdag nyid kyis shin tu rtse gcig par bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i sgra ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: and one should meditate on oneself as being of the nature of the illusion-like family that pervades everything, with one-pointed focus. The word “only” has the same meaning as before.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni padma'i rigs thugs la gnas pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni padma'i rigs thugs la gnas pa gsungs so //
translated: This is said to be the lotus family abiding in the mind.

original: rang bzhin dag par shes nas kyang //
analyzed: rang bzhin dag par shes nas kyang //
translated: Knowing the purity of nature,

original: zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid de rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid de rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: this means that suchness is consciousness.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa snang brnyan tsam ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa snang brnyan tsam ste /
translated: All phenomena are pure by nature, mere reflections,🔽because they are primordially unborn.

original: gdod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes thos pa dang / bsam pa'i shes pa dag gis nges par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gdod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes thos pa dang / bsam pa'i shes pa dag gis nges par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should ascertain this with the knowledge of hearing and reflection.

original: gang dang gang 'gro ba 'dul ba nas padma 'bebs pa'i mthar thug pa sgom pa'i mtshan nyid can de dang de ni padma'i rigs kyi dgos pa byed pa ste /
analyzed: gang dang gang 'gro ba 'dul ba nas padma 'bebs pa'i mthar thug pa sgom pa'i mtshan nyid can de dang de ni padma'i rigs kyi dgos pa byed pa ste /
translated: Whatever tames beings up to the final descent of the lotus, which has the characteristic of meditation, that is the function of the lotus family.

original: padma'i rigs kyi rnal 'byor pa des 'gro ba 'dul ba sgom pa la sogs pa de dang de'i dgos pa 'di ni padma'i rigs chen po'i dam tshig 'da' bar dka' ba ste /
analyzed: padma'i rigs kyi rnal 'byor pa des 'gro ba 'dul ba sgom pa la sogs pa de dang de'i dgos pa 'di ni padma'i rigs chen po'i dam tshig 'da' bar dka' ba ste /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: The lotus family practitioner meditates on taming beings and so forth, and that function is the difficult-to-cross pledge of the great lotus family.

original: padme'i rigs chen po ste /
analyzed: padme'i rigs chen po ste /
translated: The great lotus family is the great lotus family.

original: bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa las 'da' bar dka' ba'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa las 'da' bar dka' ba'o //
translated: It is difficult to transcend the cause of generation.

original: yang gi sgra ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i rigs la ltos nas brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i rigs la ltos nas brjod pa yin no //
translated: The word “also” is stated in consideration of the Tathāgata family, etc.

original: de'i don ni 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is taught as follows.

original: snga ma bzhin du 'gro ba 'dul ba la sogs pa padma'i rigs kyi rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor chen po byas la /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du 'gro ba 'dul ba la sogs pa padma'i rigs kyi rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor chen po byas la /
translated: As before, one should perform the yoga and the great yoga of the lotus family, such as the training in the discipline of the world, etc.

original: mchod pa thams cad kyis yang dag par mchod la /
analyzed: mchod pa thams cad kyis yang dag par mchod la /
translated: One should make offerings with all offerings,

original: phyag byas nas rang gi lha'i phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa bcings te /
analyzed: phyag byas nas rang gi lha'i phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa bcings te /
translated: and having made obeisance, one should bind the great seal of one’s deity, etc.

original: chos thams cad bdag med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i padma las byung ba thams cad du khyab pa'i rigs kyi rang bzhin snang brnyan tsam du bdag nyid rnam @175b par bsams te /
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i padma las byung ba thams cad du khyab pa'i rigs kyi rang bzhin snang brnyan tsam du bdag nyid rnam @175b par bsams te /
translated: One should imagine oneself as merely a reflection, the nature of the all-pervading family, arisen from the perfection of wisdom of the selflessness of all phenomena.

original: sems can gyi khams thams cad kyang rang gi rang bzhin du byas nas bya ba byas pa yin no zhes sems rtse gcig pas rang gi lha bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams thams cad kyang rang gi rang bzhin du byas nas bya ba byas pa yin no zhes sems rtse gcig pas rang gi lha bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Having made the whole realm of sentient beings one’s own nature, one should meditate on one’s deity with a one-pointed mind, thinking, “I have done what is to be done.”

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “There” and so forth is as before.

original: mang yang rung zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi rjas dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i nor bu'i rigs kyi rang bzhin du rdzas rnams so //
analyzed: mang yang rung zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi rjas dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i nor bu'i rigs kyi rang bzhin du rdzas rnams so //
translated: “Even if many” refers to external substances and substances of the nature of the jewel family that arise from meditation.

original: mang yang rung ba zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi rdzas sam bsgoms pa las byung ba'i nor bu'i rigs kyi rang bzhin thams cad du song ba ni /
analyzed: mang yang rung ba zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi rdzas sam bsgoms pa las byung ba'i nor bu'i rigs kyi rang bzhin thams cad du song ba ni /
translated: “Even if many” refers to all external substances and substances of the nature of the jewel family that arise from meditation.

original: ji tsam nus pa nyid du ni //
analyzed: ji tsam nus pa nyid du ni //
translated: “To the extent one is able”

original: byis pas nyi ma ma stongs par //
analyzed: byis pas nyi ma ma stongs par //
translated: “The child should not let the sun set”

original: bya ba 'di ni dam tshig yin ;
analyzed: bya ba 'di ni dam tshig yin ;
translated: “This is the rule”

original: / zhes bya ba ni nor bu'i rigs kyi rnal 'byor pa'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: / zhes bya ba ni nor bu'i rigs kyi rnal 'byor pa'i bya ba'o //
translated: refers to the practice of one who is a yogin of the jewel family.

original: sbyin pa ni gang gang sbyin pas nyi ma ma stongs par nor bu'i rigs kyi rnal 'byor pas ci'i phyir byed che na /
analyzed: sbyin pa ni gang gang sbyin pas nyi ma ma stongs par nor bu'i rigs kyi rnal 'byor pas ci'i phyir byed che na /
translated: Generosity is that by which the practitioner of the jewel family gives whatever is to be given, without delay.

original: gang gi phyir nor bu'i rigs bskyed pa ni sbyin pa'i rigs bzhin yin pa 'di'i dam tshig yin pas rgyu de'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir nor bu'i rigs bskyed pa ni sbyin pa'i rigs bzhin yin pa 'di'i dam tshig yin pas rgyu de'i phyir ro ;
translated: Why? Because the generation of the jewel family is like the family of generosity, and this is its commitment.

original: /'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: /'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: snga ma bzhin du don thams cad grub pa la sogs pa nor bu'i rigs kyi rnal 'byor dang / rnal 'byor chen po byas te /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du don thams cad grub pa la sogs pa nor bu'i rigs kyi rnal 'byor dang / rnal 'byor chen po byas te /
translated: As before, one should perform the yoga of all-accomplishing Amoghasiddhi, and the great yoga.

original: mchod pa thams cad kyis yang dag par mchod la phyag bzhi byas te /
analyzed: mchod pa thams cad kyis yang dag par mchod la phyag bzhi byas te /
translated: Having made offerings with all offerings, one should perform the four prostrations.

original: rang gi lha'i phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa bcings nos nor bu'i rigs kyi lha rnams kyi gzugs su ji tsam par bsgoms te /
analyzed: rang gi lha'i phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa bcings nos nor bu'i rigs kyi lha rnams kyi gzugs su ji tsam par bsgoms te /
translated: Having bound the great seal of one's deity, and so on, one should meditate on the forms of the deities of the jewel family to the extent possible.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa dang / sems can gyi khams phyogs gcig gam mtha' dag la dbang sgyur pa sbyin pas rab tu mgu zhing tshim nas nor bu'i rigs kyi gzugs su bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa dang / sems can gyi khams phyogs gcig gam mtha' dag la dbang sgyur pa sbyin pas rab tu mgu zhing tshim nas nor bu'i rigs kyi gzugs su bsam par bya'o //
translated: Having delighted and satisfied the Tathāgatas, etc., and the realm of sentient beings, either partially or completely, by the gift of power, one should imagine the form of the jewel-family.

original: de nas thams cad ni bdag yin no zhes nga rgyal bskyed de /
analyzed: de nas thams cad ni bdag yin no zhes nga rgyal bskyed de /
translated: Then, one should generate the pride, “All is myself.”

original: nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'i snang brnyan tsam du bdag nyid dbye ba med pa'i sems kyis bsgoms te /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'i snang brnyan tsam du bdag nyid dbye ba med pa'i sems kyis bsgoms te /
translated: And, with a mind free from conceptual differentiation, one should meditate on oneself as merely an appearance, like space.
